Subject: Looking for 2 Students helpers to help with 2D Project term 1
Body:
students,

 

Under the student helper scheme, I am looking for 2 students to help me ready up the IMU device for the uping design challenge.

Start date: Week 7 onwards

Location: Physics Lab

Task: ready up 150 IMU devices by (a) procure new battery and place in device, (b) check the device turns on, (c) check the SD card works properly, (d) procure shower curtains and nylon threads, (e) document the process via pictures and videos.

Available Hours: 100 h

Time expectation: Students can work at their pace (I wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be breatng on your neck).

 

PLEASE LET ME KNOW VIA EMAIL IF YOU ARE INTERESTED. FIRST E FIRST SERVE!

 

,

 

Franklin Anariba, PhD

Science, Mathematics, and Technology (SMT)

Affiliated with Engineering Product Development (EPD)

Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

08 Somapah Road, Singapore 487372

Subject: Invitation to participate in Inter-Varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Conversation on 26 Oct Tuesday 4.30 - 7 pm
Body:
Students,

 

We have received the following invitation from National Youth Council (NYC) to participate in Inter-Varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Conversation on 26 Oct Tuesday, 4.30 - 7 pm.

 

The engagement, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Is the Green Plan Bold Enough Ã¢â‚¬â€œ What More Can We Do?Ã¢â‚¬Â aims to increase awareness and undersding of the Singapore Green Plan 2030, and how we can build a city of green possibilities together, wle considering Singapore's context. 

 

It is a good opportunity to have SUTD students to hear from resource persons from the different unis, who are all experts in each Green Plan pillar. Additionally, the session will allow students to hear the views of their peers from different unis as well as panellists who e from Government, academic and youth backgrounds, and will be able to provide alternative perspectives for a well-rounded discussion. Mr Alvin , Minister of State for Culture, munity and Youth and Trade and Industry will also be present, and students could also leverage ts session to share their thoughts on the Green Plan directly with a political office holder. 

 

If you are keen to participate, please register at: go.gov./p2030-inter-varsity

 

Registration is open until 24 Oct 2021. For more details, please refer to the attached EDM.

 

HereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the programme for easy reference:

 

Programme

Time

Activity 

4.30pm

Introduction by emcee

4.35pm

Context Setting on the Singapore Green Plan by Ms Eleanor , Environment Policy, Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE), on Singapore Green Plan 2030

4.45pm

Breakout Sessions (10 breakout rooms, 12 students each)

 

Facilitated by students from Environmental Groups of IHLs 

Up to 2 IHL resource person/experts in each breakout

Breakout topics: City in Nature, Energy Reset, Sustainable Living, Green Economy, Resilient Future

5.40pm

Break

5.45pm

Large Group Sharing 

5x5 min sharing

6.10pm

Panel Dialogue using Pigeonhole with

 

Mr Alvin  (Minister of State for MCCY & MTI) 

Nor Lastrina Hamid (Singapore Youth For Climate Action Co-Founder) 

Melissa Low (Research Fellow at NUS Energy Studies Institute)

Dr Tricia Seow (Senior Lecturer, Humanities and Studies Edcation, NIE)

Ms Danielle Zheng (Deputy Director, Environmental Policy, MSE) 

6.50pm

Call to Action and Closing by Minister of State Alvin 

6.55pm

Close of event

 



Office of Student Life

Subject: Inter-Varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Conversation on 26 Oct 2021 (Tue)
Body:
students,

 

The National Youth Council is organising an Inter-varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Youth Conversation, wch will be held on Tuesday, 26 October 2021, from 4.30pm Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 7.00pm. 

Ts happens on Tuesday next week, wch is Recess Week.

 

Whether you are passionate about sustainability or is just starting out to find out more about the sustainability plans for Singapore, you are cordially invited to join in the conversation with youths like yourselves across 7 universities in Singapore.

 

Sign up at : go.gov./p2030-inter-varsity <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fgo.gov.%2Fp2030-inter-varsity&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccdaecadbbaf547fe62db08d9936e3ed5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637702924251356082%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dRci06Rui27xskeDo6Ws76sRpdQgW6KtJybAuB9kxeQ%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 



 

The Singapore Green Plan 2030 (Green Plan) is a national sustainability movement that seeks to rally bold and collective action to tackle climate change. It prises 5 key pillars (City in Nature, Energy Reset, Sustainable Living, Green Economy, Resilient Future), and sets out concrete sectoral plans and targets for the next 10 years. The Green Plan is a living plan, wch will evolve and be refined over time. One of its key priorities is to mobilise and empower the Public, Private and People sectors and Singaporeans to co-create solutions for sustainability. As part of ts national engagement process, the National Youth Council is planning organising a series of Singapore Green Plan Conversation to hear studentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ views on the Green Plan, and how we can build a city of green possibilities together, wle taking into account Singapore's context. We have previously conducted two of such sessions, and summaries of these can be found he youthopia./converse/greenplan/ <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fyouthopia.%2Fconverse%2Fgreenplan%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccdaecadbbaf547fe62db08d9936e3ed5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637702924251366072%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=L36kuMbgriYNZce1FfN03xnnX7Z3mqhCkOqSc76LtaU%3D&reserved=0>  

 

Here are more details on the event. 

 

Inter-Varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Youth Conversation

Date: Tuesday, 26 October 2021

Time: 4.30pm Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 7.00pm 

Mode: Virtual (via Zoom)

 

Programme

Time

Activity 

4.30pm

Introduction by emcee

4.35pm

Presentation by MSE on Singapore Green Plan 2030

4.45pm

Up to 2 NUS resource person/experts in each breakout

Breakout topics: City in Nature, Energy Reset, Sustainable Living, Green Economy, Resilient Future

5.40pm

Break

Large Group Sharing 

5x5 min sharing

6.10pm

6.55pm

7.00pm

Close of event

 

,

Mei Xuan

 

Senior Lecturer

Science, Mathematics and Technology (SMT)

Subject: Gentle Reminder <Please register for SUTD's Annual  Pedagogy Day 2021 - Happening on 9 Nov 2021!>
Body:
All 

 

      The annual SUTD Pedagogy Day is happening on 9 Nov 2021; 9am  to 4pm 

      Given the Covid situation Ã¢â‚¬â€œ we are going pletely online- for both speakers and participants. The good tng is that we can open up to more participants. So do send out to colleagues you tnk will benefit from the event. 

      Ts year we have more industrial partners and also Ã¢â‚¬Å“state of the artÃ¢â‚¬Â talks on cational technology topics by our SUTD colleagues.  For more information on the event, please visit the event website: www.sutdpedagogyday <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutdpedagogyday%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cd6110f4c79fa4225482f08d994fe8a36%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704643378309543%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cWl27sVireajfnLr87bvWgbtJw569dliJ8q7dxuK3NI%3D&reserved=0> 

      We look forward to your participation; and thank all our speakers and colleagues who are making ts possible.

      Please register here for the event: forms.office/r/ViDrg3Nvaw- <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FViDrg3Nvaw-&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cd6110f4c79fa4225482f08d994fe8a36%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704643378309543%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=v38XD8ghNnEYV5NKzkuxJgD4QwCpAOaVY7MBHUEms%3D&reserved=0>  You can attend the sessions possible. 

      We will keep posted of Zoom links and details closer to the event date. We look forward to your participation. 

 



 

Thank you and 

,

LSL Team

Subject: TTS Integration with EASE
Body:
Students,

 

As part of our Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE) integration rollout, OIT will be introducing Multifactor Authentication (MFA) to the Daily and Travel Declaration. The application will be available in the EASE homepage and can be accessed using the respective icon as explained below.

 

The change will take effect on 22nd Oct 2021, after 10 PM.

 

After the rollout, kindly clear your browser story, cache and cookies when accessing the Daily and Travel Declaration for the first time.  

 

There are 2 options to access the Daily and Travel Declaration after 10pm on 22nd Oct 2021 as shown below.

 

For Single Sign On (SSO), when you are accessing different EASE integrated applications, do use Option 1 so that you do not need to re-enter your username and password repeatedly after being authenticated.

 

Option 1: Using the application icon from the EASE homepage

 

-          Login to EASE using the URL ease.sutd../. Provide the multi-factor authentication code when prompted.

-          Use the icon below available in the EASE homepage for accessing the Daily and Travel Declaration.

 

           

 

  

 Option 2: Using the application URL

-          Login to Daily and Travel Declaration using the URL tts.sutd../. No VPN required.

-         When prompted by EASE, provide your username/password and the multi-factor authentication code.

 

If you have any questions or encounter any difficulty, please contact IT Service Desk at 6499-4500 or email: help-it@sutd.. <mailhelp-it@sutd..> 

Thank you for your support and attention.

 

 

,

SUTD IT Service Desk

Office of Information Technology (OIT)

Subject: #ProjectYOU 2021 - Join us for the Sound of Listening workshop!
Body:
Ã°Å¸â€˜â€šÃ¢Ââ€œ How Can I Be a Better Listener Ã¢Ââ€œÃ°Å¸â€˜â€š

  

 

Sometimes, we have no idea what to say when our peers are going through a difficult time. 

There are times when you are afraid you might not even say or do the right tng. 

  

Join us for Sound of Listening, a one-day workshop that will equip you with essential tips 

on how to reach out and connect with your peers who need the emotional support. 

  

Date: 30 October 2021 (Saturday) 

Time: 9.30 AM Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 5.30 PM 

Held online

Subject: 5th Row Records Data Collection for Individual Students - Trimester 3 2021
Body:
students

 

We are now collating records from 26 July 2021 to 21 November 2021 on the following areas for record purposes as well as for the preparation of the Fifth Row Certificate.

 

Please email the duly pleted form(s) to studentlife@sutd.. <mailstudentlife@sutd..>  together with the relevant supporting documents e.g. certificates or reports by 21 Nov 2021 (Sunday).

 

 

1. AWARD Template

 

Ts template is to be used for the following records. Supporting documents, e.g. certificates are required for verification purposes

 

*	Honours or awards received through participation in external petitions/events as an SUTD student representative.

 

 

2. munity and Campus Involvement (CCI) Template

 

Ts template is to be used for the following records: 

 

*	Contribution to munity and campus involvement programme through volunteer service as an SUTD student representative.

 

 

3. Projects (PROJ) Template

 

Ts template is to be used for non-SUTD clubs/student organization related projects: 

 

*	Organizing mittee/s of events and activities as well as large scale SUTD student-initiated projects
*	Involvement in events and activities as well as large scale SUTD student-initiated projects

 

You will NOT be required to update on the following records as all clubs and student organization records will be submitted to us by your respective club President :

*	List of Executive mittee members
*	List of Club Members
*	Organizing mittee/s of club events and activities
*	Involvement in club events and activities

 

 

Reminder :

*	For records related to clubs, please submit to your relevant club president and not through ts email.
*	For records such as University Outreach major event (e.g. Open House, Admissions & Career Talk, LCC), Accepce Tea, you do not need to submit through ts email as the activity organisers will submit it.
*	You are responsible for corroborating your submissions by providing genuine supporting documents for verification before the data is captured in the system.
*	Please inform Student Life if you cannot find the relevant fields in the drop-down list. 
*	To keep our records as plete as possible, please submit your information using the attached template(s).
*	The Fifth Row data collection would be pleted by 19 December 2021. Please validate your records after ts date and let us know if there is anytng amiss by 26 December 2021.

 

 

Thank you very much for your co-operation.

 



Office of Student Life

Body:

We SHARE to inspire and ignite ideas! 

 

18 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 22 October 2021

CLEAN ENERGY

New Theories And Materials Aid The Transition To Clean Energy <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fnews.asu.%2F20211014-new-theories-and-materials-aid-transition-clean-energy&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225348298%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ox9yoFGVAvXHhacTl%2FrI3oOkETvC7qCTRa%2FpC09Ho%3D&reserved=0> 









Ã¢â‚¬Å“To cut down on the time it takes to discover these new materials, researchers at MIT have developed a data-driven process that uses macne learning to optimize new 3D printing materials with multiple characteristics, like toughness and pression strength. Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Royal Institute of British Arctects (RIBA) awarded the 2021 Stephen Lawrence Prize to Tonkin LiuÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Water Tower, an adaptive reuse project wch converts a disused industrial structure in the countryside into a residential space.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The study shows how mixing multiple molecules Ã¢â‚¬â€œ up to eight at a time Ã¢â‚¬â€œ can result in a material that performs as well as the best currently known glass formers.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“In a new study, Gary Moore and s research group explore different approaches to catalysis, a chemical process that plays an essential role in biological reactions, as well as many industrial applications.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Source: MIT News <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fnews.mit.%2F2021%2Faccelerating-materials-3d-printing-1015&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225348298%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=olYdhP5gL%2By6p1iCXnAqu3HyubrdFCeSpZqWwaRMsV8%3D&reserved=0>  (15 October 2021)

Source: Archdaily <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.archdaily%2F970320%2Ftonkin-lius-water-tower-wins-riba-stephen-lawrence-prize-2021&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225358293%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=J%2Bx%2BHkjTHc1QNh8r86SPqljU5zP0jiXeQSHJREofhlU%3D&reserved=0>  (18 October 2021)

Source: Chalmers University of Technology <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.chalmers.se%2Fen%2Fdepartments%2Fchem%2Fnews%2FPages%2FMolecular%2520mixing%2520creates%2520super%2520stable%2520glass.aspx&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225368287%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HdG5m70qOG3E9cJM5DtVxcwXmYsvVtsvvQmGu4FbUVc%3D&reserved=0>  

(14 October 2021)

Source: Arizona State University <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fnews.asu.%2F20211014-new-theories-and-materials-aid-transition-clean-energy&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225368287%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Q8n61dxCFDpdQ%2F4AmHXiSFFcsBjGtXlAb4Lgs6NS%2FkE%3D&reserved=0>  (14 October 2021)

 

ELETRICAL

New Optical Switch up to 1000x Faster Than Transistors <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Foptical-switch-1000x-faster-transistors&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225378281%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gW70b4UKSNWoCXVBh%2Bru2f77GOhgYZ9qYpzchkn2I%3D&reserved=0> 

 

MAGNETIC MATERIALS

Longsding Magnetic Materials Classification Problem Solved <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.ehu.eus%2Fen%2Fweb%2Fcampusa-magazine%2F-%2Flongsding-magnetic-materials-classification-problem-solved&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225378281%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=yGLsriiYX3u04N16fodgt2k8bw2CbSRoNlrbXkdOg%3D&reserved=0> 

 

MATERIALS

New Fibers Can Make Breath-Regulating Garments <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.eurekalert.org%2Fnews-releases%2F931948&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225388278%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=aSZ1M4UAANZFJJukUuKeKzwllaLA69R544NmJ0QGMD0%3D&reserved=0> 

 

MATERIALS

How Long Can Fiber Reinforced Polymer Sustain Concrete Structures? <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.kmou.ac.kr%2Fenglish%2Fna%2Fntt%2FselectNttInfo.do%3FnttSn%3D10306853%26mi%3D4528%26currPage%3D1&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225388278%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2F0OeQKaLs62AqW0Ex%2BniIkkt4Ur6syFOio8OOEx7icM%3D&reserved=0> 

 









Ã¢â‚¬Å“A new optical switch is, at 1 trillion operations per second, between 100 and 1,000 times faster than today's leading mercial electronic transistors, research that may one day help lead to a new generation of puters based on light instead of electricity, say scientists in Russia and at IBM.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“An international team of researchers announced ts week that it has finally pleted the mathematical characterization of ShubnikovÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s magnetic and nonmagnetic crystal symmetry groups.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“A new kind of fiber developed by researchers at MIT and in Sweden can be made into clotng that senses how much it is being stretched or pressed, and then provides immediate tactile feedback in the form of pressure, lateral stretch, or vibration. Such fabrics, the team suggests, could be used in garments that help train singers or athletes to better control their breatng, or that help patients recovering from disease or surgery to recover their breatng patterns.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“One potential cost-effective way to sustain ageing concrete subjected to harsh environmental conditions is to externally coat the material with fiber reinforced polymer posites. But few studies have looked at the durability of such strengthening. Now, researchers from Korea and the USA conduct a 13-year long experiment to find out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Source: IEEE Spectrum <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Foptical-switch-1000x-faster-transistors&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225398270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gtFMOZUK4quhnqjO6kvWOGQwhCdFywEvJgrRnM6CGYs%3D&reserved=0>  (15 October 2021)

ROBOTICS

Researchers Successfully Build Four-Legged Swarm Robots <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fnews.nd.%2Fnews%2Fresearchers-successfully-build-four-legged-swarm-robots%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225438252%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YGKB33SBKupC8gz1pb7WpS%2BJ3Mr7h5PyPdt6zJeeuVI%3D&reserved=0> 









Ã¢â‚¬Å“Noninvasive glucose monitoring devices are not currently mercially available in the United States, so people with diabetes must collect blood samples or use sensors embedded under the skin to measure their blood sugar levels. Now, with a new wearable device created by Penn State researchers, less intrusive glucose monitoring could bee the norm.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The team was able to aceve ts device alongside with the recent emergence of macne learning concepts into photonics, wch promises unprecedented capabilities and system performance.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ts work with Mini Cheetah has to contend with Earth gravity, however, wch puts some fairly severe time constraints on the whole reorientation tng with the penalty for failure being a smashed-up robot rather than just a weird bounce. When we asked the ETH Zurich researchers what might improve the performance of SpaceBok, t told us that "heavy shoes would definitely help," and it looks like the folks from Notre Dame had the same idea, wch t were able to implement on Mini Cheetah.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“The collective behaviors of ants, honeybees and birds to solve problems and overe obstacles is sometng researchers have developed in aerial and underwater robotics. Developing small-scale swarm robots with the capability to traverse plex terrain, however, es with a unique set of challenges.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Source: Penn State News <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fnews.psu.%2Fstory%2F672231%2F2021%2F10%2F14%2Fresearch%2Fmonitoring-glucose-levels-no-needles-required&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cca922de740dd47def24c08d9950c58ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637704703225448246%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=S3IRC3ZtBxCvtoL2CVgaz04WtlP8EVNJ5mR4XCSjE%3D&reserved=0>  (14 October 2021)

Subject: Photog Challenge Round 2!
Body:
SUTD,

 

Photog Circle is back with yet another round of your favourite Photog Challenge!

 

If you have favourite moments that you have captured recently or just need a springboard to dive into ts creative and diverse world of photography, our 'Photog Challenge' is the perfect opportunity for you to showcase your photos!

 

For ts month, the theme for the submissions is 'Household Still Life'. With the tightening of the Covid-19 rules, and the ing recess week, most of us will be spending our time at home. Share with us your favourite moments, item or person at home! Be creative! We look forward to your submission!

 

Submit your photos via ts online form <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPawmVfnE9HRPuklUk58tCohUQ0dXVTBNNUhDTExHVEQ1QzVCVzFINEkyWi4u&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C656a88f1274f4da566d008d996ef3b04%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637706777104782904%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4qepvgxnDt6CQjUlbE8RVTgYwGGgPjZL8SPtLiOrdVk%3D&reserved=0>  

 

All submissions close by 12th November 2021. Top 15 photos will be featured on our Instagram and awarded with grab vouchers! In addition to that, there will be an additional audience choice award and ExcoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s favourite with grab vouchers to be earned!  So grab your camera or smartphone and get snapping!

 

 

We look forward towards your submission!

Best,

Photog Circle

 EPF: Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage 

 

!

 <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> 

Ã®ÂÂ¨

Ã®ÂÂ¨

2 Years Apart, 1 Question | SUTD's Class of 2021 Official Grad Video <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> 

The Finale Sunrise Show Episode:Dedicated to the people who made it

www.youtube <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfc0e3f23391f43763a9908d9872a04d3%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637689436812480314%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=nsexYGeddD%2FbfhW6HSLCEzuEobPJCyG46lI%2BmTR2FxM%3D&reserved=0> 

Ã®Å“â€˜

Ã®Å“â€˜

 

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

1. To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.





It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Publicity Director of Productions

Project Director of Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage

Ã®Å“â€˜

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage.

 Virtual help sessions for MU 
 
 all (bcced),

I am happy to do virtual help sessions for MU in recess week on Wed, Thurs, or Fri afternoons (prefer not early mornings) if anyone is interested. If so - do get together with some friends (or all those in the cohort who are interested), and do let me know.

You will receive an email of your teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s virtual bingo card on 1 November. Individuals will also receive their teammatesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ details in the same email. You can carry out your online group activities any time from 1-14 November 2021.

Subject: Get your tickets to our Space Mission Discovery program!
Body:
<apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.isset.space%2Fpages%2Faws&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfeafa509966443abd8f908d99788b064%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707435939568712%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=chgAlJ%2Fa0Nilln%2FBks6eTWVJXnonTfnQNhJPuMLCu8E%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Do you want to meet a NASA Astronaut?

ISSET in collaboration with Amazon Web Services will send a group of lucky students to Mission Discovery <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.isset.space%2Fproducts%2Fmission-discovery-singapore&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfeafa509966443abd8f908d99788b064%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707435939578706%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=paHWYs4lziz9GTcJU5toCQQ9yxRO9394NMLTPfkOcIo%3D&reserved=0>  and to our virtual Launch Prize challenge. <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.isset.space%2Fpages%2Flaunchprize&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfeafa509966443abd8f908d99788b064%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707435939588701%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NSnspp5XG1GUCefDGWU%2B1aGNDd89ZYRerqoVF2d%2FN4s%3D&reserved=0> 

At Mission Discovery, you and a friend will work with NASA astronauts to e up with a project to be launched to the International Space Station! 

 

All students will also have the chance to join our awesome Launch Prize virtual challenge, worth up to D $747.00 (NZD $820.00 | AUD $731.00)

 

How to enter?

 

Send us a short video (less than 50seconds) introducing yourself and answering one of the following questions: 

Ã°Å¸Å¡Â® Tell us your ideas for cleaning up space junk 

Ã°Å¸â€ºÂ° How can we use satellites to tackle climate change? Ã°Å¸â€™Â«

Wch is your favourite Space start-up pany and why? Your entry doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t need to be overly plicated Ã¢â‚¬â€œ get creative and have fun!

 

Who Can Enter?

 

You donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have to be crazy about science, or the smartest kid in class - everybody has an equal opportunity to win. Who knows where your video will take you! 

 

Participant eligibility:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ You must reside in either Australia, New Zealand or Singapore.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ You must be currently studng in an institution (Secondary school, Junior College, Institute of Technical cation, Polytechnic, University)

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ You must be 14 years old and above. 

 

Submit your video here <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.isset.space%2Fpages%2Faws&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfeafa509966443abd8f908d99788b064%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707435939588701%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UABku%2F%2BMCUr9ClrSxt2bTpC5RL7m7LEM8C1YyjJ9F5Y%3D&reserved=0>  before 31st October 2021 and shortlisted entries will be notified in mid-November 2021! 

 

Visit www.isset.space/pages/aws <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.isset.space%2Fpages%2Faws&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfeafa509966443abd8f908d99788b064%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707435939598696%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=n8%2BURksfAoEaowJLvVTc1eWSeAcKerZd%2FWX1A%2FhNE%3D&reserved=0>  for more details. Good luck!

 

 ,

Career Development Centre

Subject: Sharing of Personal Experience with Scholarships and/or Financial Aid/Grants
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Student,

 

Details about scholarsps and financial matters are usually municated via numbers, tables, sharing the facts and figures. However, we also know that one of the effective ways to share information and facts is through stories that readers can relate to.

 

Therefore, we are reacng out to you to find out more about your personal experience with the various financing options in funding/enricng your studies and student life at SUTD, be it scholarsps and/or financial aid/grants for tuition fees, exchange, hostel, etc.  

 

We would really appreciate it if you could reply to a few simple questions listed below.

 

1.	What scholarsp and/or financial aid/grants did you benefit from?
2.	How did it benefit you?
3.	Please share a story or an experience that ghlights how the scholarsp and/or financial aid/grants benefitted you.

 

The information you shared will be inputs for us when developing materials related to scholarsps and financial matters, for example as quotes in brochures and flyers, in social media posts and blog stories. In the process of crafting these materials, we might also e back to you to seek for additional information or materials.

 

Thank you in advance for helping us with ts! Will be great if you could reply with your responses by 1 Nov (Monday).

 

,

	
Office of Student Administration

 

 <www.sutd../> 

	
	
8 Somapah Road

Singapore 487372

 <www.facebook/sutdsingapore/>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2F.linkedin%2Fschool%2Fsutd%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C56841ee0b2e947ceef6008d997731a00%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707343097499706%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dUxiyZZd4beFp4LQQXNDzLuLXUA%2FrMrIAPtFZ54dYt8%3D&reserved=0>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Ftwitter%2Fsutd&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C56841ee0b2e947ceef6008d997731a00%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707343097509705%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8uv6VnOvsprxHRvgblK%2Bn7jKct31vLRC54JdZXGQ%3D&reserved=0>    <www.youtube/user/SUTDSingapore>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram%2Fsutd%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C56841ee0b2e947ceef6008d997731a00%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707343097519694%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5aK%2BjWlfwukEAZ7G%2F%2F%2BCDkmGRZdhGIyA7VCv3KMjE%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: United Women Singapo STEM Speaker Series - The Next Frontier Part 2
Body:
all


 

Sharing with you an uping plimentary virtual event by United Women Singapore on 6 Nov, 10am to 11am, featuring Dr Sara Spangelo, co-founder and CEO of Swarm Technologies, a pany that is democratising data access to everyone in every corner of the Earth through their sandwich-sized satellites.

 

Find out more from the emailer below.

STEM Speaker Series- 
The Next Frontier Part 2


 

 <mcusercontent/b423b1d88258bf63ea1e4995f/images/58679996-0ee3-3aae-2071-b6d0da2c54ec.png> 

 

Dr Sara Spangelo is the co-founder and CEO of Swarm Technologies, a pany that is democratising data access to everyone in every corner of the Earth through their sandwich-sized satellites.

e and listen to her, as she talks to Haslinda Amin about the inspiration and challenges of her profession and her passion for space exploration as an aspiring astronaut!

Register now for the second episode of the series focusing on women in Space. 

 

Event date: Saturday, 6 November 2021

Time: 10.00 am - 11.00 am T via Zoom

plimentary Access

 

Register now! <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fuws.us3.list-manage%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3Db423b1d88258bf63ea1e4995f%26id%3Daf78e6f007%26e%3D00b1594ae3&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C629df8d23fef481a93e808d9976eaf32%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637707324153884911%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=I8i32cWet8FcJeY3T1ihH0Youvs20vC9yCXudJ7LCTU%3D&reserved=0>  

 

About the STEM Speaker Series

United Women Singapore's STEM Speaker Series aims to feature globally acclaimed women in STEM fields wch are male-dominated. Ts series is a platform for these remarkable women role models to share the experiences that shaped them and inspired them to aceve greatness and the challenges t had to overe in the course of their journey.

 

About Dr Sara Spangelo 
Prior to founding Swarm, Dr. Sara Spangelo worked on small satellites and autonomous aircraft at the University of Micgan and was a lead systems engineer at both NASAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Jet Propulsion Lab (JPL) and Google X. Her expertise is in modeling and optimizing satellite constellations to maximize impact and business opportunities. Sara holds a Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Micgan and in 2017 was a Top 32 Canadian astronaut candidate.

 Sunday, 17 October 2021 6:06 PM
 Spaces <spaces@sutd.. <mailspaces@sutd..> >
 Request for extension of cohort classroom access

 

To whom it may concern,

 

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m  , a term 3 student. I'm writing in  to the opening hours of the cohort classrooms.

First of all, I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the offices for making physical classes possible during ts tough period. 

 

As projects, like 1D and 2D, are kicking in, I've received feedback from my fellow batchmates that t would like an extension of classroom access till 10pm for subsequent weeks (Week 6 to 14). An example would be for 10.023 Designing Energy Systems students, groups are building physical prototypes, like a peltier fridge and a solar powered device. Such prototyping heavy projects are difficult to do without meeting physically. Furthermore, as many Term 3 students do not stay in hostel, t can't access the group study room and school campus is the only alternative for them. Thus, we would like to seek your kind assisce to extend the hours. 

 

If we're given the extension, we would ensure safe management measures (SMM) will be strictly abided, such as submitting our ART results for weekly campus access and remaining in our groups of 2 for Week 6 and groups of 5 for subsequent weeks. In addition, we undersd OCIF's potential consideration of the electricity wastage. Thus, we are agreeable on working on just turning on the classroom fans, as long as access is granted.

 

Lastly, I thought that it would be nice if ts extension could be provided for the Term 1 students as well, since t are starting on projects. 

 

Thus, we would like to seek the approval from OCIF and would greatly appreciate it. On behalf of the SUTDents, thank you so much for your undersding. Feel free to reach out to me for any further clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

Subject: 2021 September Term - 10.022 : Modelling Uncertainty: Modelling Uncertainty Week 8
Body:
students,

- Please be reminded that Homework 3 and the 1D project are both available now. T are due after recess (on 3 Nov and 12 Nov respectively).

- It is ghly probable that the second half of the term will continue to be conducted physically. Please remember to take the ART test before returning to campus.

- For some of the cohorts, the Weeks 8 and 9 timetables will be slightly different due to makeup classes, so please check your timetable carefully.

- I have been handling quite a few requests regarding exam viewing etc. In accordance with the policy given in the course information, no such requests will be considered after tomorrow (since it will be 1 week after the release of the scores).

Best wishes,

James

Subject: Announcement on the Soft Launch of DesignZ
Body:
SUTD munity,

 

SUTDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s mission is to advance knowledge and nurture technically grounded leaders and innovators to serve societal needs, with a focus on Design, through an integrated interdisciplinary curriculum and research. As SUTD embarks on the next phase of growth towards ts mission, we are pleased to announce the setting up of DesignZ in SUTD with effect from 27th October 2021.  Professor Tai Lee Siang will be leading ts new initiative as the Centre Director. A team of DesignZ staff will assist Lee Siang towards aceving our strategic goals in ts area.  

 

DesignZ is the next generation Design Centre set up to further reinforce Design as a core offering of SUTD through 4 main areas: Research, Innovation, Services & cation (RISE). The main objective is to establish an integrated partnersp with the public and private sectors by offering advocacy and leadersp in Design through RISE, focusing on sustainability & circularity approaches to solve challenges and bring about transformations of recognizable value to the industry and society at large.

 

Witn SUTD, DesignZ will offer design cation and research to equip students with design fundamentals, strategies and solutions through Design focused programmes in Design & Artificial Intelligence (DAI), Master of Innovation by Design (MIbD) and SUTD-ZJU Collaboration (SUTD-ZJU). DesignZ aims to build design talents with key mindsets and all-rounded capabilities in disciplines of engineering, arctecture, industry design, innovation, business, entrepreneursp and management, and will contribute to foster expedited munication across fields, building leaders and innovators of global product-service-systems that can work effectively and efficiently across the full value chain.

 

With the formation of DesignZ, the IDC will cease with its activites subsumed under DesignZ. The IDC has played an import role in providing seeding funding and infrastructure at the early stage of the university development. It has built the foundation for DesignZ to take our design to next height.

 

We look forward to your support for DesignZ as SUTD forges ahead in the next phase of growth.



 

,
Tow Chong

Subject: OCIF Maintenance Circular 05/2021 - Fire Alarm Systems for the month of October 2021
Body:
SUTD munity, 
 
We will be carrng out testing of Fire Alarm Systems on Saturday 30 October 2021 from 9.00am to 12.30pm at Academic Building.  Ts testing is necessary as per authority requirement and to ensure that the critical campus Fire Protection Systems are functional and in working condition. 
  
During ts period, the following systems will be activated:- 
  
*	Fire alarm will be triggered, 
*	PA system will be activated, 
*	Lifts will be homed to level 1, 
*	Fire roller shutter will be activated, 
*	LPG gas supply will be shut off, 
*	Smoke ventilation system will be triggered, 
*	Pressurization system, 
*	Auto sliding door system, 
*	Security access card and EM lock system. 
  
Please do not be alarmed if you hear the alarm bells or the announcement from the PA speakers. Our duty security officers will be available to assist you during a real fire situation. Kindly contact the security hotline at 6303 6666 if you require any assisce. 
  
Thank you for your patience and kind undersding. 


,
Office of Campus Infrastructure and Facilities	
 	
  	
Note: Please do not reply to ts email. Replies to ts email are routed to an unmonitored mailbox. If you have any enquiry related to events, please contact SUTD Events at 6499 4056 or sutdevents@sutd.. <mailsutdevents@sutd..> . For other matters, please contact our Help-Facilities at 6303 6699 or email help-facilities@sutd.. <mailhelp-facilities@sutd..>

Subject: TCS Sustainathon 2021 - Making sense of sustainability challenges
Body:
Students, 

 

cation is a powerful driver of development and instrumental in closing poverty gaps, improving health, driving gender equality and supporting a nationÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s prosperity. The changing global demands and COVID pandemic have upended the way we learn, and presented new trends, emerging opportunities, and challenges. Ts season, we want YOU to reimagine, retnk and reinvent the learning experience for all Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the what, why and how!

 

TCS Sustainathon SingaporeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s launch webcast is happening on Tomorrow, 27 October 2021, 5PM. Hear from the challenge masters from National Institute of cation Singapore, NTUC LearningHub and  Enable who will be sharing more about the challenge statements and discover how you can reinvent and reimagine cation alongside with speakers from Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands Singapore and Nanyang Technological University! Ts is perfect opportunity for you to find out more and plan your way to ace your idea proposal!

 

We wele all of you to join us in ts interesting discussion about cation and get us all tnking about how we can reimagine cation.

*	Security access card and EM lock system. 
  
Please do not be alarmed if you hear the alarm bells or the announcement from the PA speakers. Our duty security officers will be available to assist you during a real fire situation. Kindly contact the security hotline at 6303 6666 if you require any assisce. 
  
Thank you for your patience and kind undersding. 


,
Office of Campus Infrastructure and Facilities

Subject: MechD CAD Fiesta
Body:
fellow CADers, 

 

Want to make your recess productive? Looking for a new skill to learn? Looking for ways to put your creative ideas into design? Scared to start CADing? If it is a yes for any of these questions, you are at the right place.  We got you covered with our MechD CAD Fiesta where we conduct beginner workshops for Solidworks and Fusion 360. 

 

Venue: Online (MSTeams-link will be sent closer to the date)

Workshop 1: Basic Fusion 360 Workshop

Date: Thursday, October 28, 2021

Time: 14:00-17:00

 

Venue: Online (MSTeams-link will be sent closer to the date)

Workshop 2: Basic Solidworks Workshop

Date: Friday, October 29, 2021
Time: 14:00-17:00

 

Join us for these workshops to kickstart your CADding skills and you might even get a chance to win a Keychron K2 Wireless Mechanical Keyboard by participating in our MechD Design Challenge 2021. Subject: EPF: Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage
Body:
,

 

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

 

Start time/ date 

End time/ date 

Activity (filming, video editing, etc)

Venue 

No of Pax 

(indicate the number of crew, number of actors)

Logistics 

8 July 1000

8 July 1700

Filming

AMS and IDiA Annex

4 crew
1 cast

Film equipment and props

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Access to campus and declaration of Participants  (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Nov. The declarations and required documents are due 3 working days before each session (except for the first few days of resumption and except those submitting valid negative COVID-19 test results). Please indicate in the file all the proposed dates to return to campus.

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Declaration of Vaccination Status in the Declaration List

	*	Declare vaccination status of each participant in the declaration list under column D and obtain the required documents from the participants after seeking their consent. 
	*	Staff advisor will verify and let you know if the documents are acceptable and if the participants are approved to participate in the activity.

Classification of Vaccination Status

Under Vaccination Status in Declaration List, fill in:

Documents required

Fully vaccinated participants1

A

Vaccination report 

- Please remind participants to redact their NRIC except the last 4 characters before submitting 

- Refer to Annex A: Part A

Participants who have recovered from COVID-19 (witn last 270 days) 2

B

PET Exemption Notice or Discharge Memo indicating exemption period

- Refer to Annex A: Part B

Unvaccinated participants

C

Valid negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken witn the past 24 hours at an MOH-approved medical service provider before the expected end of the training session.

- Refer to Annex A: Part C

- Please submit the valid negative COVID-19 test result before 2pm on the same day of the training session. If anyone require more time to submit the test result, please inform staff advisor in advance.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	1.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	2.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	3.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	4.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	1.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	2.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

 

,

Crystal

www.youtube <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccd20460c73b146aa529c08d9993e630d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637709316584711085%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YG1h6MuONt3DSqQPhtU0pxfdtc64iq2lG09JPeV6NzI%3D&reserved=0> 

Ã®Å“â€˜

Ã®Å“â€˜

 

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

1.	Sign up form: forms.office/r/dQhV1WwnBV <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FdQhV1WwnBV&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccd20460c73b146aa529c08d9993e630d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637709316584721085%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2FALdjazK0t%2B8V3tK20jEJdWyzaLs6xLSFMnbMY8sP8%3D&reserved=0> 
2.	 
3.	Booking of timeslot: docs.google/spreadsheets/d/161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccd20460c73b146aa529c08d9993e630d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637709316584721085%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=K1zChZPJmWlauq0v3EM6S%2FO0WKs1e6HyGD%2FtGioXbXM%3D&reserved=0>  (we will edit the timing closer to the date, when we confirm our timetable for Week 9-11)

3.	Publicity Message: docs.google/document/d/1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fdocument%2Fd%2F1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Ccd20460c73b146aa529c08d9993e630d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637709316584731073%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=aF%2FWPPw7QP252nP25tmsOU9x4dRjRzkRjNrmlwrzi3k%3D&reserved=0> 

To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.

 

It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Publicity Director of Productions

Project Director of Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage

Subject: Notice for Students (28 October 2021)
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

Date    :          

28 October 2021

To        :         

All Students

 

 Students,

As Singapore extends the stabilisation phase, the teacng plan will remain and Safe Management Measures (SMMs) will align with the national sce of transiting to a COVID-19 resilient nation and the Ministry of cation (MOE)Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s advisory to IHLs on Safe Management Measures (SMMs). 

 

Minor changes are ghlighted in yellow for easy identification.

 

 

(A) Teacng Plan: 1 Nov to 17 Dec 2021 (Week 8 to 14 )

 

1.           Term 1 and Term 3 subjects will continue on-campus lessons in the respective designated cohort classroom except:

*         A few classes may have specific requirements for online learning mode. The respective faculty/office will inform you for these classes, if applicable.

 

2.           Term 6 subjects, including HASS electives and Term 10 subject(s) 

a)    Subject(s) shall continue with online classes till end of the term. Physical studentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ presentation may resume progressively, subject to approval by UGS and Incident manders. The respective faculty/office will inform you for these classes, if applicable.

b)    Subject(s) that are given approval by UGS and Incident manders to have on-campus lessons previously, can continue with the necessary SMMs in place.

 

3.           PG subjects will continue with online classes during office hours and can be physical after 6pm till end of term. Hybrid mode may resume progressively, subject to the latest advisory from the related government agencies.

 

4.           Mid-term and final examinations can be conducted on campus.

 

5.           Class Size

 

a)    Class size of all physical lessons is capped at 50 pax (including instructors). 

b)    Any classes with more than 50 pax (including instructors) will go online. The respective subject lead and pillar/cluster will inform the students for these classes of the arrangements, if any.

c)     Group work in physical classes, if required, should be done in groups of not more than 2 persons, in line with the permitted group size for social gatherings. 

d)    The attached Cohort Classroom layout for Term 1 and Term 3 students remain. (Note: The seating plan is aligned with the permitted group size allowed for physical classes. Your assigned seat number remains the same. Instructors will have the discretion to work with students to further fine-tune the grouping if required.)

 

6.           Faculty/Students should have their mask on at all times, and maintain a safe discing of at least 1 metre between persons (or between groups of not more than 2 persons for group activities/team-based labs/projects/ASD studios). No intermingling between groups.

 

7.           Graduate students performing research who need to return to research-lab/facility, please continue to seek clearance via your advisors/project-PIs/lab-managers. All Graduate Student Clusters (GSC) will remain closed until further notice.  However, you may request (via gsc@sutd.. <mailcharlene_ng@sutd..> ) to schle a time-slot for ah-hoc access to your work desk. 

 

Notes for Section A 

 

*         As the situation is fluid and teacng plan can change in a short span of time, please refer to the instruction from the faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices for the latest and specific arrangement. 

*         If you have an online lesson in-between two on-campus in-person lessons, or back-to-back between an online lesson & on-campus in-person lesson on the same day, 

a)            you shall go to interim study room/library/open spaces/ASD respective studios and designated rooms for online lessons/self-study, subject to availability and safe discing measures

b)            return to hostel room, if you are a hostel resident.

*         Please refer to the attached updated PDF for the operating hours at the respective academic spaces and facilities. The operating hours is subject to changes in response to the evolving situation. Students shall refer to the latest notice from the respective departments or offices (e.g. Library/Fab lab)

 

(B) Reminder on the Weekly Antigen Rapid Test (ART) self-test

 

1.     The ART self-test kits can be purchased from various retail pharmacies, general retail shops as well as e-merce platforms. Students can purchase their own kits to self-test at home/ hostel or as a sdby in case of invalid result. 

 

2.	Regular testing is an import part of the national strategy to detect cases early and curb transmission. The weekly ART testing has already started from 10th October, Sunday. The last submission of test results will be on 28th November, Sunday. 

 

a)    Students can download the Ã¢â‚¬ËœTimestamp Camera BasicÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ or similar app from App/Play Store as t need to upload the photos of the ART test results with date/time stamped as proof. 



 

b)    Students who have to return to campus are to ply with the prescribed testing schle on every Sunday. (See Table 1).

 

Please do the ART self-test on every Sunday and submit the test results by 11.59pm through the Daily and Travel Declaration via tts.sutd.. <tts.sutd..> . Results are valid for one week (e.g. 1 Nov to 7 Nov) for class/exam, research activity and Fifth Row Attendance for the cycle. In addition, please retain a photo of the test result as you may be subject to random verification by designated staff/security. Should you obtain Ã¢â‚¬Å“positiveÃ¢â‚¬Â, please follow MOH protocol www.covid.gov./ <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.covid.gov.%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cd200b1cab9c84de6be2508d99a00235e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710148505711512%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2WOH5lQG4xspe6g1T3N1estvgp5DU39tKwNbdiYy3OQ%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Table 1



 

c)     Hostel Residents who do not have classes & exams/ research activity/Fifth Row Activities on campus for the week, are strongly encouraged to do ART self-test on every Sunday and submit the test results by 11.59pm through the Daily and Travel Declaration via tts.sutd.. <tts.sutd..>  . Results are valid for one week (e.g. 1 Nov to 7 Nov) for class/exam, research activity and Fifth Row Attendance for the cycle. In addition, please retain a photo of the test result. Should you obtain Ã¢â‚¬Å“positiveÃ¢â‚¬Â, please follow MOH protocol www.covid.gov./ <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.covid.gov.%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cd200b1cab9c84de6be2508d99a00235e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710148505721506%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HnTwu0vNfTqcG3XIjySrWgjf1SrcPn114QmUA%2BWKE8A%3D&reserved=0>   Hostel residents must also inform Office of Housing or the Residential Life Coordinators to seek further instructions. 

 

d)    Students with no submission or submitted positive ART results must not e for classes/exams, perform research activity and Fifth Row Activities for the cycle. If t attend classes/exams, perform research activity and Fifth Row Activities in any day of that cycle, t will be issued a Letter of Warning. 

 

e)    Office of Student Admin (OSA) will flag up ART test submissions to faculty. Students in the above categories cannot attend classes/exams or perform any research activity during the 7-day cycle. Office of Student Life (OSL) will only allow participants with ART negative results for Fifth Row Activities. 

 

f)      Students are required to retain photo evidence of their negative ART result on their mobile phone. Designated Staff/Security on campus may conduct random verification checks to ensure veracity of the ART results since these images also reflect the dates and times at wch the images were taken. 

 

 

(C) Leave of Absence (LOA)

 

There is no change to the attached protocols and scenarios sent on 11 October 2021.

 

When you are not able to attend classes due to reasons such as the above scenarios or other medical reasons, please do:

*         inform your faculty of your absence

*         submit your leave of absence via MyPorta <myportal.sutd../psp/EPPRD/?cmd=login&languageCd=ENG> l> NavBar> Navigator> Self Service> Leave/Withdrawal Request> Leave of Absence Application.

 

(D) Safe management measures

 

Please continue to observe the safe management measures on the days when you are on campus.

 

(I) Before you e to campus

 

Please check in using the TraceTogether token or app before you are allowed entry onto campus. You should have your TraceTogether token or app with you throughout.

 

(II) When you are on campus

 

1)    Masks must be worn at all times except when you are eating or drinking.

2)    The start and end time of each class must be strictly adhered to.  If you are unwell with dry cough, fever and tiredness, do not e to class but visit the Public Health Preparedness Clinic (PHPC).

3)    You are required to do your daily health and contact declaration via the Daily and Travel Declaration System at tts.sutd.. <tts.sutd..> .

4)    You will only be allowed on campus on the days when you are schled for classes and/or related academic activities.  The security will have the class list for verification.

 

(III) Teacng venues

 

1)    You can only be on campus for the duration of the class instructions and related academic activities. 

2)    Venues designated for teacng will have the requisite social discing measures in place.

3)    The University would need to keep records of studentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ seating arrangements (e.g. Faculty taking photos at the start/end of sessions) to allow affected students to be identified quickly in the event of a confirmed case and for subsequent contact tracing.

4)    Once the class instructions and related academic activities are over for the day, please do not loiter around the classroom. For those who are hostel residents, please return to the hostel; for the rest, please leave campus as soon as possible.

5)    Please observe personal and environmental hygiene with regular hand wasng.

 

As these measures are to ensure the safety and wellbeing of everyone, pliance is mandatory.  Disciplinary actions will be taken against the student(s) for any violation.

 

,

Office of Student Administration

Ã¢â‚¬Å“A research led by scientists from City University of Hong Kong (CityU) has successfully developed a super-strong, ghly ductile and super-light tiium-based alloy using additive manufacturing, monly known as 3D printing. Their findings open up a new pathway to design alloys with unprecedented structures and properties for various structural applications.  Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ã¢â‚¬Â¦scientists studied rats in a virtual reality maze. Wle observing the activities of large numbers of individual neurons in each animalÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ppocampus, the scientists discovered responses in those neurons that revealed a specific mechanism for navigationÃ¢â‚¬Â¦The study could help explain why people with damage to the ppocampus struggle not just with so-called spatial tasks, like finding their way home or locating a lost set of keys, but also with memory tasks, such as recalling what t had for lunch or whether t took their daily medication.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tap water produces a natural protective seld against harmful microplastics, wch can help prevent household products such as plastic kettles from releasing them.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“In a new Concordia-led paper published in the journal Biosensors and Bioelectronics, researchers describe a new liquid biopsy method using lab-on-a-cp technology that t believe can detect cancer before a tumour is even formed.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“A special artificial intelligence (AI)-based puter algorithm created by Mount Sinai researchers was able to learn how to identify subtle changes in electrocardiograms (also known as ECGs or EKGs) to predict whether a patient was experiencing heart failure.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Scientists also use gh-tech methods to control light in the laboratory, and now, thanks to a new breakthrough that uses a specialized material only three atoms tck, t can control light more precisely than ever before.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“In research published in the journal Nature <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.nature%2Farticles%2Fs41586-021-03885-6&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfc54e7cefe15454be23008d99a8c81ed%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710751019274661%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=XD8VBaM0RUqYxRYQTUHllBKsIFQMNBvknFaVGazt4%3D&reserved=0> , the team demonstrates a solid ion conductor that bines copper with cellulose nanofibrils Ã¢â‚¬â€ polymer tubes derived from wood. The paper-tn material has an ion conductivity that is 10 to 100 times better than other polymer ion conductors.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Source: Uni Concordia <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.concordia.ca%2Fnews%2Fstories%2F2021%2F10%2F19%2Fconcordia-researchers-develop-a-new-way-to-find-cancer-at-the-nanometre-scale.html%3Fc%3D%2Fnews%2Fmedia-relations&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfc54e7cefe15454be23008d99a8c81ed%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710751019284652%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=pEZLeIb2Jij%2BqeJ%2BQD8txw1k8bdprYbrzRXiMcy2hRI%3D&reserved=0>  (19 October 2021)

WATER PURIFICATION

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Researchers from the Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS) have developed a shape-sfting material that can take and hold any possible shape, paving the way for a new type of multifunctional material that could be used in a range of applications, from robotics and biotechnology to arctecture.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Researchers proposed a single-layer hydrogel artificial skin, termed Ã¢â‚¬ËœSHARKÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, that bines gh stretchability, self-healing properties, and ultrasensitive mechanical sensing.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Recent work has shown that bagworm silk is superior to spider silk in both strength and flexibility. Building on these findings, a research team at the University of Tsukuba, led by Professor romasa Goto, has harnessed the strength of bagworm silk to produce a strong, flexible, conductive fiber. Ts research may lead to new flexible electronic devices, such as wearable electronic materials.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Using sopsticated microscopy and putational analysis, Texas A&M University researchers have now validated the merit of a water purification technology that uses electricity to remove and inactivate an assortment of waterborne viruses. T said the yet-to-be-implemented water purification strategy could add another level of safety against pathogens that cause gastrointestinal ailments and other infections in humans.Ã¢â‚¬Â

How to Create a Powerful LinkedIn Profile LinkedIn has more 55 million registered panies, and some 86 percent of recruiters use LinkedIn to help them find qualified candidates. Ts means if you're looking to grow your career, using the networking platform is a necessity. And if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re looking to improve your LinkedIn presence, then youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll want to be sure youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re following the below best practices, wch will make your LinkedIn profile as powerful as possible. Articles from career resources on Vault

How to Improve Your Networking Skills in 6 Short Steps If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not networking, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not growing your career.  ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s that simple. Networking is your career lifebloodÃ¢â‚¬â€whether you work for someone else or are an entrepreneur. You can have the best skills or concept in the world, but if you arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t making new connections and expanding your reach, your efforts are going to stagnate pretty quickly. So here are six critical tips and methods to help you improve your networking skills. Read more <firsthand.co/blogs/networking/how-to-improve-your-networking-skills-in-2021>

Subject: PayPalÃ¢â‚¬â€SUTD Women Luminaries Programme
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

<Sent on behalf of Paypal>                                            

 

 Student, 

 

Supported by PayPal, the PayPalÃ¢â‚¬â€SUTD Women Luminaries Programme is available to outsding female undergraduates pursuing their studies at SUTD.

 

We are supported by people like you

Diversity is the catalyst of innovation. At PayPal, we are mitted to driving innovation with a diverse team, and that means creating more opportunities for women to thrive.

The PayPal Women Luminaries Program is an all-rounded program for passionate female undergraduates to build a solid foundation for a tech career, and develop the skills needed to bee leaders in ts field.

As a Luminary, you will receive the following benefits:

*	A one-time scholarsp of D4,000 to offset your cation expenses
*	An internsp at PayPal to explore the world of digital payments, with opportunities of conversion to a full-time position upon graduation
*	Exclusive access to mentors and internal technical courses, workshops and social events at PayPal

Program Eligibility:

*	A Singaporean Citizen or Permanent Resident
*	Currently enrolled as a full-time Year 2/3 undergraduate in SUTD
*	Passion in Technology
*	Demonstrates passion and strong interests in tech and innovation, with track records of contributing to the tech munity

For more details on the program and to apply, visit: www.paypal//webapps/mpp/wlp <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.paypal%2F%2Fwebapps%2Fmpp%2Fwlp&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C27781131f3564bc419f008d99abb6512%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710951926666833%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=teSeStU43w2pPFvz33iBYON9n4fLAfY9a9ejOgLJRdw%3D&reserved=0> .

Subject: [Restricted] [2021486] Acceptance of Students@Part-Time Work Scheme Application Form submission
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

   ,

We have received your application form for the engagement with Science, Mathematics and Technology. Below are the engagement details:

ring Department

Science, Mathematics and Technology

Job Description and brief description of work

Student Helper for Week 11 Design Challenge

Start date

November 2021

End date

December 2021


You may start your engagement with the department on the mentioned dates above. 

Do take note that there are maximum hours that you are allowed to work during term time and vacation period. Also, in accordance with the Employment Act, breaks are required for certain number of hours worked.  

Students working for multiple departments are to bine the work done for each month in ONE timesheet. Students are to submit separate requests (via CONCUR) for each department that work has been done for using the same timesheet.

Please familiarize yourself with the Terms and Conditions of the Students@Part-Time Work Scheme in the Application Form wch can be viewed at the following link www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme <www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme> . 

You may download the timesheet and user guide for the Concur submission from the above-mentioned website. 

Do note that students serving Leave of Absence are not allowed to work under the Scheme. Please inform Science, Mathematics and Technology as soon as possible if you are on Leave of Absence and to cease your work engagement with the department immediately.  

Thank you and wisng you a great day ahead. 

 

,
Norimah
Office of Student Life

Subject: Requesting for an event approval for Week 11
Body:
To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C34b541c0e5344474491008d99aaf6612%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637710900683118611%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wugm4zuuQ3UZZZv3h0RNVY49U%2BmuPIxoEjG5XS%2FrRao%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: 2021 September Term - 10.022 : Modelling Uncertainty: Modelling Uncertainty Week 8 (part 2)
Body:
students,

Thanks for your midterm survey ments. I would like to address two issues raised the

(1) Due dates of the remaining homework sets. Here t a

HW4: due 5pm, Fri 19 Nov (Week 10)

HW5: due 5pm, Wed 1 Dec (Week 12)

HW6: due 5pm, Mon 13 Dec (Week 14)

You already know the due dates of HW3, 1D and 2D, so now you know all the import dates.

(2) Extra practice. There are many options:

- Weekly extra questions. Even though there are not many questions, each question is carefully written to reinforce your undersding, and the format is similar to the exam questions. Answers are also provided (Week 6 answers are ing shortly).

- The textbook, wch you can find in the library and online. Relevant chapters of the book contain many basic examples and drill-type questions; answers to odd-numbered questions can be found at the back of the book. (Please note that the book uses slightly different notations from the slides.)

- I have opened 2 Cerebry sessions (class code: SUTD-MU) on the basics of probability and integration respectively. Disclaimers: the sessions are not graded (so do not prioritize your time on them); not all integration questions are relevant (some are much harder than what weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll need); the basics of probability are still relevant to the rest of the course (however, some questions are about cards); I didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t write the questions (so expect wording issues; the exams will be much better worded); I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t guarantee the correctness of all solutions, and some are indeed suboptimal (but the sessions had been tested on an earlier course, so the solutions are very likely to be correct).

Best wishes,

James
