 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C8f42f757eab9415c3a0308d99af60d5e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637711203846580901%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gez%2Fj%2BHP%2BcE1WoB6DsCJoP1AHQoibMZYTSMnT06pbqU%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: Media and Marketing Proposal for The Collage Network
Body:
Good day,

 

I am Darren Chan from ROOT group Welfare 03 and attached are our marketing and media proposal as well as materials for our uping event, The Collage Network. The marketing campaign for our event will run from week 9 till the end of week 11.

 

Kindly note that the marketing materials shown in ts proposal is mainly for use in week 9.

We will be following up on ts proposal at the end of ts week (around 5 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 7 November 21) with additional materials meant for dissemination from week 10 to week 11.

 

For more information on the event itself, the proposal has been sent to OSL and queries regarding the event can be directed at our Project Director, Cheng Wei Xuan [weixuan_cheng <mailweixuan_cheng> ].

For any queries with  to our marketing campaign, feel free to contact me or Vainavi [vainavi <mailvainavi> ].

 

Thank you very much!

 



Darren Chan Yu Hao | 1006340 | SC03

Student, Singapore University of Technology and Design

Subject: 2021 September Term - 02.001 : Global Humanities: Literature, Philosophy, and Ethics_Zhenxing: Arrangement for Wee 8
Body:
All,

I'm sorry to inform you that I haven't got the tickets until now because of the plicated procurement process and payment procre.But I will keep you informed about the way to pick up your tickets.
Please note that our recitation for ts week is replaced by fieldtrip. The time to visit the garden is flexible, because we are unable to do group activities ts semester. You will need to arrange your own time to e and visit the garden.
Please read the academic paper "Consuming Beauty_ The Urban Garden as Ambiguous Utopia" carefully, then write a 150-250 word summary and submit it to e-dimension by next Monday.

Best,

Zhenxing

Subject: Summer Programme 2022
Body:
<wearesutd.sutd../uncategorized/summer-programme-2022/> 

 

 Students,

 

Are you planning for the uping summer? 

 

Enrich your academic experience with an exciting and transformative short term overseas experience. SUTD has a vast suite of summer programmes catering to the diverse interests of students. 

 

SUTD Summer Programmes fall into three categories:

* currently programmes from countries under the Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) with Singapore are offered

 

Global Leadersp Programme (GLP) <www.sutd../Student-Development/Global/Summer-Programmes/glp> 

 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      One of SUTDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s premier signature programmes 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      At least 8 weeks duration at one of SUTDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s top partner institutions overseas

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      International social network platform to interact and exchange ideas 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      Hone your leadersp skills

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      Do look out for the OSA email on the GLP programme selection process.

 

Summer Programme (Sponsored) <www.sutd../Student-Development/Global/Summer-Programmes/Programmes-with-Sponsorsp> 

 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      Sponsored Summer Programmes provide sponsorsps to support participating students with their overseas travel/programme related expenditures

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢      Please look out for our email broadcasts for sponsorsp details

 

Summer Programme (Self-paid) <www.sutd../Student-Development/Global/Summer-Programmes/Self-Paid-Summer-Programmes> 

 

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢       SUTD offers a wide selection of overseas & virtual summer programmes through partner universities from our global networks.

 

Note: SUTD will continue to monitor the COVID-19 situation worldwide and the list of countries under the Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) with Singapore. Due to the unpredictability, Host Universities and/or SUTD reserves the right to cancel Summer 2022 at any point in time. The decision will be final. SUTD strongly encourages all students to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 before embarking on any overseas exchange programme.

 

Any questions? Connect with us at global@sutd.. <mailglobal@sutd..> ! 

 



 

Any queries? Connect with us at global@sutd.. <mailglobal@sutd..>

Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Student, 

 

The Home Team Scholarsp Centre at Ministry of Home Affairs would like to invite you to join their uping virtual programme - Home Team Discovery Series, wch will be held from 9-15 December 2021. T will be launcng a series of webinars, with each session focussing on sharing from the career reps of the respective Home Team Departments and Civilian Career tracks. The intent of ts series is to expose you to the different kind of meaningful work wch the Home Team Uniformed and Civilian officers do and most importly, the scholarsp opportunities wch are available for application.

Subject: EPF: Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage
Body:
,

 

We will need to seek clearance from OCIF and OH for your filming. Before that, we need to clear your RA with EHS.

  EPF: Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage 

 

 ,

 

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

Access to campus and declaration of Participants  (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Nov. The declarations and required documents are due 3 working days before each session (except for the first few days of resumption and except those submitting valid negative COVID-19 test results). Please indicate in the file all the proposed dates to return to campus.

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Declaration of Vaccination Status in the Declaration List

	*	Declare vaccination status of each participant in the declaration list under column D and obtain the required documents from the participants after seeking their consent. 
	*	Staff advisor will verify and let you know if the documents are acceptable and if the participants are approved to participate in the activity.

Classification of Vaccination Status

Under Vaccination Status in Declaration List, fill in:

Documents required

Fully vaccinated participants1

A

Vaccination report 

- Please remind participants to redact their NRIC except the last 4 characters before submitting 

- Refer to Annex A: Part A

Participants who have recovered from COVID-19 (witn last 270 days) 2

B

PET Exemption Notice or Discharge Memo indicating exemption period

- Refer to Annex A: Part B

Unvaccinated participants

C

Valid negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken witn the past 24 hours at an MOH-approved medical service provider before the expected end of the training session.

- Refer to Annex A: Part C

- Please submit the valid negative COVID-19 test result before 2pm on the same day of the training session. If anyone require more time to submit the test result, please inform staff advisor in advance.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	a.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	a.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	b.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	c.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	a.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	b.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

 

,

Crystal

The Finale Sunrise Show Episode:Dedicated to the people who made it

www.youtube <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C02fd227383794368da2708d99d203323%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637713583904024630%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NtmBRNY43MUVPm74wKsLuFN4jCSC0so1u0m8XEdmk%3D&reserved=0> 

Ã®Å“â€˜

Ã®Å“â€˜

 

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

1.	Sign up form: forms.office/r/dQhV1WwnBV <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FdQhV1WwnBV&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C02fd227383794368da2708d99d203323%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637713583904034620%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=bZnXPLROQa7prabssd8k2%2FayFmvVuob7N8y7La9BKP0%3D&reserved=0> 
2.	 
3.	Booking of timeslot: docs.google/spreadsheets/d/161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C02fd227383794368da2708d99d203323%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637713583904034620%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=F3mhLRp6tTvs5gwHqaBuiqfDbgH1SZzlffjuWhOTbH0%3D&reserved=0>  (we will edit the timing closer to the date, when we confirm our timetable for Week 9-11)

1.	Publicity Message: docs.google/document/d/1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fdocument%2Fd%2F1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C02fd227383794368da2708d99d203323%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637713583904044612%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=GDDUY4tWgbpMmAoad6JtyrEYY6MAlpdHqqQO6Q0uuMg%3D&reserved=0> 

To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.

 

It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Publicity Director of Productions

Project Director of Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage

Subject: [Application closes 7 Nov 2021] Higher Education Community Bursary & Higher Education Bursary Schemes
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Students,

 

The gher cation munity Bursary & gher cation Bursary Schemes are now open for application. 

 

The deadline for application is on Sunday, 7 November 2021. Please note that there will be no extension of deadline.

 

Each eligible student is entitled to receive the gher cation munity Bursary or gher cation Bursary once in each academic year. Students who have been awarded the bursary earlier ts year do not have to submit an application again.

 

To apply, please log in to MyPortal (myportal.sutd.. <myportal.sutd..> ) > Self Service > Campus Finances > Scholarsps & Financial Aid.

 

Once the Financial Aid/Scholarsps Application page is displayed, click on the Ã¢â‚¬ËœAddÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ button beside the Academic Program. Click on the drop-down menu for *Financial Aid/Scholarsps Type and select one of the financial aid/scholarsps options (Bursaries) and click the Ã¢â‚¬ËœFindÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ button. Please select FA code: FAGOVTBUR.

 

For more information on the bursaries, you may refer to the following weblinks:

 

gher cation munity Bursary Scheme: sutd../Admissions/Undergraduate/Financial/Financial-Aid/Bursaries/gher-cation-munity-Bursary-Scheme <sutd../Admissions/Undergraduate/Financial/Financial-Aid/Bursaries/gher-cation-munity-Bursary-Scheme>

Should you have any queries, please contact us at email: scholarsps_financialaid@sutd.. <mailscholarsps_financialaid@sutd..> .

 

Thank you.

Subject: ROOT NYC URA LTPR Engagement Session
Body:
SUTDents, 
We have an exciting opportunity for you!

Long Term Plan Review <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.ura.gov.%2FCorporate%2FPlanning%2FLong-Term-Plans%2FLong-Term-Plan-Review&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfaaaece112244a4707e208d99e16c40a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637714643048504173%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8Oy3gL4Lu7zuHdz686c6uJc18CRFhGhWt1ZJuLx9A%2Fc%3D&reserved=0>  is conducted every 10 years, to keep Singapore's planning relevant to changes.
You can find out more about LTPR, and what has been done so far here

ROOT is collaborating with the National Youth Council (NYC) and Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) to hold a Long-Term Plan Review engagement session for SUTDents on 
Ã°Å¸â€œâ€¦: 10th November 2021, Week 9 Wednesday
Ã°Å¸â€¢Å¸: 330pm to 6pm. 

Ts session is specially conducted for SUTDents and is part of a series of conversations to collect youths' opinions. 
The findings will be consolidated to be presented as a collective voice of youth in January 2022.

During ts session, we will discuss how to plan for Singapore to be:
1. Inclusive
2. Adaptable, Resilient & Sustainable
3. Distinctive & Ening

Ts dialogue will be open to ALL SUTDents, undergrad and post-grad (Masters / PhD), from ALL pillars, as we would love to have diverse views.

As our school motto goes, A Better World By Design, we hope that ts can be a good opportunity for enthusiastic SUTDents to voice out their opinions to shape a future-ready Singapore!
Ã¢â€°Â We have limited slots available, and all participants receive $5 Grabfood voucher as a token of appreciation. 

Last but not least, if you are interested, please sign up here <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl%2FSUTDLTPRFGD2021&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cfaaaece112244a4707e208d99e16c40a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637714643048524168%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=s9PEDCEwErltbeBLMuLqlsX2cXF%2Bp6IVhO%2FbZcoKvTk%3D&reserved=0>  (tinyurl/SUTDLTPRFGD2021)!

Thank you, take care and stay safe!

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

Access to campus and declaration of Participants  (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Nov. The declarations and required documents are due 3 working days before each session (except for the first few days of resumption and except those submitting valid negative COVID-19 test results). Please indicate in the file all the proposed dates to return to campus.

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Declaration of Vaccination Status in the Declaration List

	*	Declare vaccination status of each participant in the declaration list under column D and obtain the required documents from the participants after seeking their consent. 
	*	Staff advisor will verify and let you know if the documents are acceptable and if the participants are approved to participate in the activity.

Classification of Vaccination Status

Documents required

Valid negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken witn the past 24 hours at an MOH-approved medical service provider before the expected end of the training session.

- Refer to Annex A: Part C

- Please submit the valid negative COVID-19 test result before 2pm on the same day of the training session. If anyone require more time to submit the test result, please inform staff advisor in advance.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	a.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	a.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	b.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	c.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	a.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	b.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

1. 2.

1.	Publicity Message: docs.google/document/d/1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fdocument%2Fd%2F1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C7974457fb421466c54bb08d99e829dc4%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637715106088179939%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cAapRwvqg3A15kGYgqhvWpl275ru%2F6uABAJVqKRozro%3D&reserved=0> 

To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.

 

It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Publicity Director of Productions

Project Director of Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C5459dec28c8f48fd23fd08d99eb8d1e3%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637715338909939220%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Gqq6%2FFKXf9%2B%2FR4DcHZSIoEJlHTEXQl2%2Fx0KFFEFiUO0%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: [SOCIAL PANEL] TECH FOR GOOD
Body:

Presents

 

Tech for Good: Can we marry social impact with technology?

An Online Panel Discussion

Get inspired to take on some of their problem statements through the support of a social entrepreneursp incubation program and the Create4Good Innovation Fund.

Subject: Invitation to Sentosa's Focus Group Discussion
Body:
Students,

Sentosa Development Corporation (SDC) will be holding a Focus Group Discussion session for university students on 23 Nov 2021, from 4 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 5.30pm. As part of SDCÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s employer branding refresh, the purpose of ts Focus Group Discussion is to seek inputs and gain insights into how students perceive SDC and the considerations that students have when looking for internsp or career opportunities. 

 

During ts session, students will also get to learn more about SDC and contribute ideas to our employer branding refresh. As a token of our appreciation, we will also be giving out a Sentosa Tote Bag with goodies as well as a 30 Tokens Sentosa FUN PASSÃ¢â€žÂ¢. 

 



 

,

Davina

Subject: [External][Application Opens] 2022 Lee Kuan Yew Scholarship
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Student, 

 

Application for the 2022 Lee Kuan Yew Scholarsp opens from 1 November 2021 to 10 January 2022.

 

Eligibility 

 

Applicants, who must be Singapore citizens, will be assessed holistically. Ts includes their track record of leadersp and service (e.g., volunteer and munity work, contributions to cultural, scientific and/or academic munities etc.) as well as academic and professional acevements. 

 

Terms and Conditions 

 

Lee Kuan Yew Scholarsp recipients can pursue postgraduate studies overseas or locally to develop their potential as leaders in their respective fields. There are no restrictions on the course of study. Applicants should have at least two academic terms of study remaining at the point of application. 

 

Ts scholarsp does not carry any bond. 

 

Scholarsp recipients will receive an annual allowance of S$50,000 for up to 2 years if t are pursuing a MasterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s degree or up to 5 years for PhD studies. Ts is with the exception of public sector awardees who are already sponsored by their agencies for their postgraduate studies. These public sector awardees will receive a one-off sum of S$10,000. 

 

Method of Application 



Applicants can apply via the Gateway application portal (www.pscgateway.gov./app/lky/account/singpasssignin <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.pscgateway.gov.%2Fapp%2Flky%2Faccount%2Fsingpasssignin&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cf9f735ae619b48baae5708d99ea67bc6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637715260205001872%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=APt3sLp3fdJNTequTYHwd%2BJnoqg%2FBl2igVoPPUexLvo%3D&reserved=0> ). All pleted applications should be submitted online by 10 January 2022 (Monday), 1700 hrs. 

 

All applicants will be notified of their application outes by March 2022.

 

Thank you

 

,

	
Office of Student Administration

 

 <www.sutd../> 

	
	
8 Somapah Road

Singapore 487372

Subject: Scheduled System Maintenance - 7 Nov 2021
Body:
Students, 

 

We would like to inform you that a schled system maintenance for patcng has been schled on 07th Nov 2021. During ts maintenance, there shall be disruption to services availability as explained in the table below.

 

Date & Time

Affected Websites, Systems and Software

Impact

Date: 07th Nov 2021 (Sunday)

 

Time: 12:00 AM to 07:00 AM

 

Systems

 

*	Library My Account and Library eResources
*	Hostel Management System
*	Student Claim System (SAP Concur)
	
	

 

Websites

 

*	SUTD Website: www.sutd.. <www.sutd..> 
*	SUTD Library: library.sutd.. <library.sutd..> 
*	IT Service Desk Portal: itservicedesk.sutd.. <itservicedesk.sutd..> 

 

 

Services and Software License

 

*	Printing Services
*	Softwa Altium Designer, Arcgis, SOL, Coventor, CST, DesignBuilder, Matlab, Mathematica, Rno, RnoCAM, Solidworks

 

From 12:00 AM Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 07:00 AM:

 

The services pertaining to the systems as indicated will not be available during the patcng window.

 

Please note that the email is not affected by ts maintenance. We will do our utmost to have these systems and services up and running as quickly as possible. 

 

If you have any questions on ts maintenance, please contact the IT Service Desk at 6499-4500 or email to help-it@sutd.. <mailhelp-it@sutd..> 

 

Thank you for your attention.

 

,

SUTD IT Service Desk

Subject: Happy Deepavali from 9th ROOT & 5th SAC
Body:
SUTD Family,

 

Happy Deepavali to all our ndu Friends, may a millions lamps light your celebrations with joy overflowing and be filled with smiles and may you be blessed with good health and happiness. Ã°Å¸Âªâ€ Ã°Å¸ËœÂ

To the rest of you, Happy Holidays. I know that some of you have mid-terms ts week. I wish you all the best!! Ã°Å¸â€™Âª



When the cabinet first came into our role, we had strived to ensure that all seasonal events would be celebrated, as a result, we had decorated the canteen as always so lighten the moods of everyone during ts festive season. Hope you all enjoyed the decorations and learnt a tng or two from the posters that were put up. Ã°Å¸Å½â€¡





Ts is the 2nd year that Deepavali celebrations will be done during the pandemic, I would like to request that we stay strong, just like the light of Deepavali snes strong, let it guide us to remain strong together so that we emerge out of ts crisis together and prepared to face the road ahead with pride and confidence. Ã¢Å“Â¨

Check out our Deepavali post on Instagram @sutdlife. Give it a like and donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t forget to follow us for updates on events. Ã°Å¸â€™â€“

Thank you, take care and stay safe!

 

,

 

Mohamad Arshad

Subject: EPF: ROOT A Collage Network
Body:
To Crystal,

 

Good afternoon, I am writing ts email to update you on the Collage Network.

 

The draft email for publicity will be the following. I have attached the DoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s and DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ts poster in ts email for your reference as well.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Beloved SUTD Family~!Ã°Å¸â€™â€¢ 

 

Hope you have been enjong your year so far! To lift up our spirits, ROOT will be introducing The Collage Network! Woohoo!Ã°Å¸Å½â€° So, what is that?!?! It is SUTDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s very own online munity motivational board for all students to send encouraging messages Ã¢Å“ÂÃ¯Â¸Â to not only your friends, but also everyone in school! 

 

For our Term 1 s, physical boards will be pasted up on your cohort classroom door from week 11 too! Ã°Å¸ËœÅ Ã°Å¸ËœÅ  Feel free to decorate them and write encouraging messages! 

 

*nt nt* Ã°Å¸Ëœâ€° Delicious prizes will be awarded to the best 3 designs! Ã°Å¸ÂÂ¬ Note: Designs for the contest will be chosen on 26th November! Winners will be notified by the following week. So wait no longer, start sending your heartwarming messages and meme-worthy pictures through the padlet Ã°Å¸â€˜â€° here! 

 

P.S The board will be open from now till end of Week 12 so when you need some feels during the stressful crunch time, you know where to go~ Ã°Å¸ËœÂ 

 

Do follow the instructions listed in the DoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s/DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ts listed in the above illustrations!Ã³Â°Å¾Â¹ We canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t wait to see all your messages! Ã°Å¸â€˜â‚¬ Take care and stay safe, everyone!!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

As for the physical wteboards, we will be setting them up in these classrooms.

Sc01 - 1.314

Lastly, I would like to check if we were to borrow a portable TV instead, would the reviewing of our video also take 2 weeks?

 

Thank you for your time and I look forward to your reply. 

 

,

Cheng Wei Xuan

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cccf46723aa704035170e08d99f596703%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637716028715289256%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=pPhc%2BdKwllmsL6h4Py2VaUHQfV9LIKV3dx8iQ1zN%2F9c%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: Floor Cleaning Email
Body:
Thank you for your email.

 

We would like to apologise for the mismunication as the schled email did not proceed as planned.  We are currently working with Office of IT to undersd the issue.

 

We thank you for your email and, again, apologised for the inconvenience caused.

 



 

Office of Housing

 

 Student -  ,  <_> 
 04 November 2021 13:54
 SUTD Housing <ecchousing@sutd..>
 Floor Cleaning Email

 

 Sir/Madam,

 

Today, my floor had floor cleaning, but I didn't receive any email about it. Could I check if any email was sent out or was it just me who didn't receive it? 

 

My floor has quite several shoes along the corridor. As a House Guardian, I wasn't able to inform them about it earlier to keep their shoe in. As a result, the cleaner had to keep all the shoes wch is additional task to their job. Really sorry about it! 

 

Hope to hear from you soon. Have a great Deepavali holiday.

 

Yours sincerely,

Subject: [Confidential] Students@Part-time Work Scheme Application Form - For Virtual FACT 2021 Videos
Body:
Message Classification: [Confidential]

 

 ,

 

Hope ts email finds you well.

 

Ts is Dorothy from Office of International Relations and I undersd from Noah that you are keen in assisting to do up a video for our virtual FACT programme.

 

Thank you for your interest and we are pleased to proceed with the engagement based on the following parameters:

 

*	Number of videos to be submitted: 1
*	Number of working hours: ~6 hours in total
*	Submission: week of 20 Dec 2021

 

As you will be remunerated under the SUTD Students@Part-time Work Scheme for the above work, we are also sharing the scheme T&Cs and Application Form for your pletion. Kindly refer to document as attached.

 

If you are acceptable to ts work, we would appreciate if you could send the pleted form to me by 10 November 2021. These are the fields in the application form that you would be required to fill in:

 

*	Student Name & ID
*	Contact Number
*	Programme/Course (please circle one)
*	Year of Admission
*	Declaration (please tick the 3 boxes)
*	Signature of Student and Date

 

*you may leave the <ENDORSEMENT BY RING DEPARTMENT> and <APPROVAL BY DEPARTMENT HEAD / PROJECT INVESTIGATOR> sections blank.

 

You may notice that the Ã¢â‚¬ËœDuration of WorkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ has been indicated as 3 months from Nov 2021 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Jan 2022. Ts is just an indicative duration and the remunerated hours will be based on your actual number of working hours.

 

If you have any enquiries or face any issues filling up the form, please feel free to let me know.

 

We look forward to hearing from you.

 

Thank you.

 

,

Dorothy

Office of International Relations

Singapore University of Technology and Design

Subject: EPF: ROOT A Collage Network
Body:
Wei Xuan,

 

For the email draft, if you intend to send ts out before the physical wteboard section is cleared, you may want to indicate that ts is still TBC at ts point of time.

 

We do not have TVs for loan. The 2 weeksÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ timeline includes the process of vetting of videos, editing (if any) and clearance for the use of campus TV wch involves multiple departments Ã¢â‚¬â€œ OSL, Marketing, OCIF and IT. The timeline is actually quite reasonable and if all clearance can be obtained earlier, I will definitely inform you on that.

 

,

Crystal

 Crystal Qua <crystal_qua@sutd..>; Student Government - Events <events@studentgov.sutd..>

  EPF: ROOT A Collage Network

 

To Crystal,

 

Good afternoon, I am writing ts email to update you on the Collage Network.

 

The draft email for publicity will be the following. I have attached the DoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s and DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ts poster in ts email for your reference as well.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Beloved SUTD Family~!Ã°Å¸â€™â€¢ 

 

Hope you have been enjong your year so far! To lift up our spirits, ROOT will be introducing The Collage Network! Woohoo!Ã°Å¸Å½â€° So, what is that?!?! It is SUTDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s very own online munity motivational board for all students to send encouraging messages Ã¢Å“ÂÃ¯Â¸Â to not only your friends, but also everyone in school! 

 

For our Term 1 s, physical boards will be pasted up on your cohort classroom door from week 11 too! Ã°Å¸ËœÅ Ã°Å¸ËœÅ  Feel free to decorate them and write encouraging messages! 

 

*nt nt* Ã°Å¸Ëœâ€° Delicious prizes will be awarded to the best 3 designs! Ã°Å¸ÂÂ¬ Note: Designs for the contest will be chosen on 26th November! Winners will be notified by the following week. So wait no longer, start sending your heartwarming messages and meme-worthy pictures through the padlet Ã°Å¸â€˜â€° here!

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cf1b4d38e6df54048068108d9a0312c1b%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637716955310524549%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=O2qrmlW8pvDAUs44bdcbmQ3EQT%2FRnguw50b4nKGUYuI%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

  Term 1 Class Fund Claim Procre

 

 ,

 

Below is a summary of the fund claims process as a refresher. Ts information was previously  shared with your batch of cohort student excos (Chair, Deputy Chair and Treasurer) and cohort advisors during one of the excos and cohort advisors  dialogue session in  Term 1, AY2020. Hope ts helps. Thanks.

 

Student Claims

-          Students to submit email approval from cohort advisor, scanned copy of receipt and fund utilisation form in concur.

-          Students to obtain approval from cohort advisor before proceeding with purchase. Class funds cannot be used for repair/ replacement of items in cohort classroom, fort items such as sleeping bed, couch, cuson and decorations items. Class fund is only used for team bonding activity. Please check with your cohort advisor if you are unsure of the items wch are claimable before proceeding with the purchase to avoid your claims being rejected.

-          Students to key in correct information reflected on the receipts in concur to avoid delay in processing of claims. Incorrect information reflected in the claims will be returned to students.  

-          Please indicate the GL Project as 00OSXP in your class fund claims submission in Concur. The Budget Center, Cost Center and GL Account are as per below: 

 





Bee Foong

 ,

 

The students can spend the class fund of $250 for ts term even if t have not selected the treasurer yet. But t have to seek the approval from  the faculty / staff cohort advisor. We can only conduct the first exco meeting when all the cohorts excos are elected. Most of the  cohort advisors are experience and t have also been cohort advisors for last few years. Thus t would be able to  advise the class on the claims process  eg filling in the budget utilisation form and submitting the claims through the Concur system together with the receipts. We will conduct the briefing for the claims process during the first excos meeting. Meanwle students may consult their cohort advisors for advise on the claims  process before the first excos dialogue session. For info the concur system is under Finance and if students required a detailed briefing on the system, we will need to seek FinanceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s help to conduct the briefing.

 

In all cases, please consult the faculty cohort advisors first. Most of them except for the new cohort advisors are very experienced and t would be able to advise the students  base on a case by case basis.

 

Let me know if you still encounter any problems.

 

Thanks

 



Bee Foong

If the concur briefing will not be conducted anytime soon, is it possible to clarify the procre on how classes can use the fund and claim it first? In another words, could you provide us the finance/claim procre on how to use class fund for classes who has a class m and for those who don't have one respectively? 

 

Lastly, when will the first cohort meeting for the class exco mittee and the concur briefing for the treasurer be? We're tnking that it'll be good to allow classes to settle down quickly since t only have 2 terms together (wch means almost 1/4 is over).

 

Thank you for the hard work arranging all the class matters in midst of ts pandemic! We really appreciate it Ã¢ÂÂ¤Ã¯Â¸Â

 

Have a great day ahead!

 

Yours sincerely,

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

 

Start time/ date 

End time/ date 

Activity (filming, video editing, etc)

Venue

Access to campus and declaration of Participants  (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Nov. The declarations and required documents are due 3 working days before each session (except for the first few days of resumption and except those submitting valid negative COVID-19 test results). Please indicate in the file all the proposed dates to return to campus.

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Declaration of Vaccination Status in the Declaration List

	*	Declare vaccination status of each participant in the declaration list under column D and obtain the required documents from the participants after seeking their consent. 
	*	Staff advisor will verify and let you know if the documents are acceptable and if the participants are approved to participate in the activity.

Classification of Vaccination Status

Under Vaccination Status in Declaration List, fill in:

Documents required

Fully vaccinated participants1

A

Vaccination report 

- Please remind participants to redact their NRIC except the last 4 characters before submitting 

- Refer to Annex A: Part A

- Refer to Annex A: Part B

Valid negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken witn the past 24 hours at an MOH-approved medical service provider before the expected end of the training session.

- Refer to Annex A: Part C

- Please submit the valid negative COVID-19 test result before 2pm on the same day of the training session. If anyone require more time to submit the test result, please inform staff advisor in advance.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	a.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	a.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	b.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	c.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	a.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	b.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.

 

It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

Subject: Monthly Refuse Chute Fogging on 6 November 2021
Body:
Residents,

 

 

MONTHLY REFUSE CHUTE FOGGING 

 

 

Please be informed that we will be carrng out Pest Control Maintenance (Thermal Fogging) to the buildingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s refuse chute at Block 51, 53, 55, 57 and 59 for the Month of November 2021 on 6th November 2021, Saturday from 8am to 1pm.

 

 

Do take note that the date and time is subject to change to the next available day/time if it rains heavily / continuously.

 

Please refrain from using the refuse chutes during the above mentioned period as smokes from the thermal fogging will rise up from level 1 to level 12 and do not be alarmed if smoke are seen ing out from the refuse chute.

 

Thank you and we apologise for the short notice. 

 



 

Office of Housing

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C5a9bc65f097644fb59ff08d9a0d6ddb2%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637717666988815907%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CGrs6%2Ff8vz%2F4xSms%2BtB%2BQC5LRYpQlGE5D7jcLQNICRs%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

Access to campus and declaration of Participants  (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Nov. The declarations and required documents are due 3 working days before each session (except for the first few days of resumption and except those submitting valid negative COVID-19 test results). Please indicate in the file all the proposed dates to return to campus.

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Declaration of Vaccination Status in the Declaration List

	*	Declare vaccination status of each participant in the declaration list under column D and obtain the required documents from the participants after seeking their consent. 
	*	Staff advisor will verify and let you know if the documents are acceptable and if the participants are approved to participate in the activity.

Classification of Vaccination Status

Under Vaccination Status in Declaration List, fill in:

Documents required

- Please remind participants to redact their NRIC except the last 4 characters before submitting

Valid negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken witn the past 24 hours at an MOH-approved medical service provider before the expected end of the training session.

- Refer to Annex A: Part C

- Please submit the valid negative COVID-19 test result before 2pm on the same day of the training session. If anyone require more time to submit the test result, please inform staff advisor in advance.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	a.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	a.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	b.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	c.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	a.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	b.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

www.youtube <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cdb4316f28c8748fd0a4b08d9a276e347%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637719453933280218%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Ta2qVFd6nQg0lRA8ben9G4dIotDnNIgB8uftae9mFDw%3D&reserved=0> 

Ã®Å“â€˜

Ã®Å“â€˜

 

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage. 

 

Here are the materials:

1.	Sign up form: forms.office/r/dQhV1WwnBV <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FdQhV1WwnBV&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cdb4316f28c8748fd0a4b08d9a276e347%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637719453933290196%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=N34ra7CLT5sAPQmIhGOSfF1O7sT%2ByGBlIJZeXiZ2twU%3D&reserved=0> 
2.	 
3.	Booking of timeslot: docs.google/spreadsheets/d/161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F161kLx9pVi7QngxLEHGBI-G5Ev0Zl3zFDbaggiArx7mg%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cdb4316f28c8748fd0a4b08d9a276e347%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637719453933300189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cg3oOIzwworagGz60M2kJ7LcjljUC6iSFcQem%2FK5ZA4%3D&reserved=0>  (we will edit the timing closer to the date, when we confirm our timetable for Week 9-11)

1.	Publicity Message: docs.google/document/d/1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs/edit?usp=sharing <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google%2Fdocument%2Fd%2F1RzBmis9dAm2knqRoH65WpXoHa-hHm6jti44gv3VyoHs%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cdb4316f28c8748fd0a4b08d9a276e347%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637719453933300189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sYxRYPePg09xrvKaOfQD%2BUhaHMqycuLFlpEkHwvbFPU%3D&reserved=0> 

To answer your concerns on our SMM, I have created a document with the measures that we will implement during the filming. I've submitted the PDPA form and include the clause in the sign-up form as well. $100 would be requested from Ine Fund to purchase props if filming requires. If it's not used, we would prepare a gift of token for the interviewees at the end of Term 8. No ine will be generated from ts project.

 

It would be good if you can advise on what are some other locations we can consider and wch areas are forbidden. For filming in hostel, we would seek Office of Housing approval to film in mon areas (like benches, study room, recreational room and interviewee's room). As it's a short period of time only (15min slot per interviewee) in mostly mon area (Jackie Chan Pavillion, Canteen...), is venue booking required?

 

Sorry for the long message!! I hope the informative message will clear any doubts you have. Feel free to clarify the information if it's unclear. Hope to seek your approval on ts event. 

 

Have a great day!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Publicity Director of Productions

Project Director of Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage

Subject: [HG Newsletters] Issue 2: Hello 999?
Body:
Residents!

Hope that the term has been kind to you thus far!

The House Guardians newsletter team is back with our 2nd edition of our e-newsletters (attached).

For ts edition, we've included a brand new "Cultural Connect" segment to introduce our different cultures here in SUTD. Ts edition's country is Indonesia, and we've gotten our very own HG, Nathan Chang, to share some fun facts about Indonesia.

Additionally, we have a special segment for all you foodies out there. Check out the "Hostel Food Hacks" segment for fast and easy recipes for the busy weeks ahead!

If you have feedback on how we may improve our newsletters, or would like to contribute an anecdote/ic strip/memorable quote etc. to us, we would love to hear from you!

Happy reading!


Sincerely in Service, 
Kellie Sim (Telegram: @kellief0rnia <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fkellief0rnia&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C6fc4c6d3ecdd4058129e08d9a2a4e82e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637719653807765206%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=t3xzoaIR0CTuIPeUhEDSnwJeX%2FReHdBdNFaxM6uhZRQ%3D&reserved=0> )

EPF Status: Pending Review

*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Risk Assessment

*	Please include the following in the Risk Assessment Form and resubmit to us by 29 Nov :

	*	Covid-19 as a hazard and indicate your control measures. The control measures should include all the Safe Management Measures in the paragraph above
	*	Maximum capacity for interviewee, interviewer who are on screen and crew members who are off screen
	*	How many people can remove mask, and what is the control measures when masks are removed?
	*	What is the safe disce (in metres) between students? Eg. 2m when masks are removed, 1m when masks are on

 

Safe management measures

*	Please follow the safe management measures for filming and incorporate it into your Risk Assessment Plan. 

	*	Number of people

		*	Limit group size to no more than 2 participants.
		*	Removing mask indoors will only be permitted if all performers/crews/helpers on the premises (including those that may not have direct contact with unmasked participants) are either: (i) fully vaccinated; (ii) recovered from COVID-19; or (iii) have obtained a negative result on a Pre-Event Test taken in the past 24 hours before the expected end of the event.

	*	Safe disce

		*	Maintain at least 1m safe disce between students, including those remaining masked, as a general rule, although transient contact between students during a performance is acceptable.
		*	All unmasked performers should maintain at least 2m safe disce from others.
		*	Groups should maintain 3m disce between each other

	*	No audience is allowed (barricade the area, if required)

 

Venue booking

*	Please provide the full list of venue that will be used for filming purposes by 29 Nov. Most of the venues require booking except for open areas, walkways, corridor, etc.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Import Notes to Club Leaders

	a.	Please seek the consent from all participants before collecting the vaccination reports/PET results/required documents. These data are collected only for the purpose of participation in fifth row activities. 

		*	If anyone does not give consent, you should not collect the documents from m/her. He/she will also not be able to participate in the unmasked indoor activities. 
		*	If anyone would like to submit s/her documents directly to the staff advisor rather than through club exco, please facilitate to link up both parties.

	a.	Ensure that anyone who is not granted approval by staff advisor should not participate in any unmasked indoor activity of your club. Disciplinary actions will be taken if there is any breach.
	b.	Take attendance of each session and submit to staff advisor witn the next day.
	c.	Delete the copies of documents collected from participants after session has ended.

*	[For Unmasked Indoor Activities] Footnote:

	a.	An individual is considered fully vaccinated two weeks after he/she has received two doses of approved vaccines. 
	b.	Recovered individuals (witn last 270 days) can obtain a PET Exemption Notice from any clinic offering ART or PCR testing services.  Refer to go.gov./swabproviders for the list of MOH-approved COVID-19 test providers.

Have you watched the Class of 2021 Graduation Video Montage? Did you use boxes of tissue to wipe your tears up because it's just too toucng? If you did, you're not alone because me too (excluding the tissue part)! If you haven't, what are you waiting for, prepare a tissue box and watch it here <www.youtube/watch?v=vZ8dc9Jwp0s&t=2s> !

 

Continuing the great legacy Faheem, Adam and the team aceved, Noah, Sihan, Aretha, n Shao and I are motivated to continue to bring smiles to people. We felt that it would be meaningful to have a video montage dedicated to our batch with all the memories of having supper together, stang up till dawn and pleting 3.007 project. Thus, we are embarking on ts project, the Class of 2024 Graduation Video Montage, with an EPF and RAF. 

 

Similar to their video, we will be asking interviewees a question once in Term 3, Term 5/6, Term 8 (when we graduate). For editing purposes, we would ask 3 questions and pick the best response out of the 3 for the video montage.

Subject: [Application Open] Tuition Fee Loan, Study Loan and CPF Education Loan Scheme
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Students,

 

We would like to inform you that application for the following financing schemes for your undergraduate studies is now open. Please note that the following schemes will only take effect from January 2022 Term onwards upon approval. 

 

For the following schemes, only a one-time application is required. Students who had applied previously and are already on the scheme(s) need not re-apply.

 

Financing Scheme

Deadline for Application 

How to Apply

Coverage

Applicable to

Details of Scheme

CPF cation Loan Scheme

3 January 2022, Monday

Apply online via CPF website (SC & SPR)

Hardcopy Submission (IS only)

Subsidised tuition fees payable by Singapore Citizens.

Note: Subject to availability of funds in CPF account.

Students who wish to use their parentÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s CPF savings to pay for their tuition fees.

sutd../Admissions/Undergraduate/Financing-Your-Studies/Financial-Options-Financial-Aid/Other-Financing-Options/CPF-cation-Loan-Scheme 

Tuition Fee Loan
(TFL)

7 January 2022,
Friday

Visit any branch of Development Bank of Singapore (DBS) directly with your guarantor to submit your application.

Up to 90% of subsidised tuition fees payable by Singapore Citizens.

Singapore Citizens, Singapore Permanent Residents and International Students who are on Tuition Grant Scheme, and wish to take up a loan for tuition fees.

sutd../Admissions/Undergraduate/Fees-Financial-Matters/Financial-Aid/Tuition-Fee-Loan

Study Loan
(SL)

4 February 2022, 
Friday

Submit the SL application form, along with all the necessary supporting documents to Office of Student Administration (OSA) for us to verify your eligibility.

Note: You can only apply for SL following approval of TFL by the bank.

Up to 20% of subsidised tuition fees payable by Singapore Citizens.

Optional: Living allowance of up to $3,600 per academic year.

Singapore Citizens, Singapore Permanent Residents and International Students who are on Tuition Grant Scheme, and wish to take up a loan for tuition fees/ living allowance.

sutd../Admissions/Undergraduate/Financial/Financial-Aid/Study-Loan-Scheme

 

Late or inplete submission will not be processed.

 

We hope the above is helpful to you. Should you require any clarification or assisce, please contact us at email: scholarsps_financialaid@sutd.. <mailscholarsps_financialaid@sutd..> .

 

Thank you

 

,

	
Office of Student Administration
