 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cd159ba7153c64b8c1d3808d9a3668217%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637720482935395380%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PbAvBk3XpmBcDTk7lm7zTH6J6YC08SFtkVGw8us6ex4%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: 5th Row Records Data Collection for Individual Students - Trimester 3 2021
Body:
students

 

If you have any relevant records, ts is a gentle reminder to submit all documents by 21 Nov 2021 (Sunday).

 



Office of Student Life

 

 Student Life 
 Friday, 22 October 2021 2:50 pm
 Student Life (studentlife@sutd..) <studentlife@sutd..>
 5th Row Records Data Collection for Individual Students - Trimester 3 2021

 

 students

 

We are now collating records from 26 July 2021 to 21 November 2021 on the following areas for record purposes as well as for the preparation of the Fifth Row Certificate.

 

Please email the duly pleted form(s) to studentlife@sutd.. <mailstudentlife@sutd..>  together with the relevant supporting documents e.g. certificates or reports by 21 Nov 2021 (Sunday).

 

 

1. AWARD Template

 

Ts template is to be used for the following records. Supporting documents, e.g. certificates are required for verification purposes

 

*	Honours or awards received through participation in external petitions/events as an SUTD student representative.

 

 

2. munity and Campus Involvement (CCI) Template

 

Ts template is to be used for the following records: 

 

*	Contribution to munity and campus involvement programme through volunteer service as an SUTD student representative.

 

 

3. Projects (PROJ) Template

 

Ts template is to be used for non-SUTD clubs/student organization related projects: 

 

*	Organizing mittee/s of events and activities as well as large scale SUTD student-initiated projects
*	Involvement in events and activities as well as large scale SUTD student-initiated projects

 

You will NOT be required to update on the following records as all clubs and student organization records will be submitted to us by your respective club President :

*	List of Executive mittee members
*	List of Club Members
*	Organizing mittee/s of club events and activities
*	Involvement in club events and activities

 

 

Reminder :

*	For records related to clubs, please submit to your relevant club president and not through ts email.
*	For records such as University Outreach major event (e.g. Open House, Admissions & Career Talk, LCC), Accepce Tea, you do not need to submit through ts email as the activity organisers will submit it.
*	You are responsible for corroborating your submissions by providing genuine supporting documents for verification before the data is captured in the system.
*	Please inform Student Life if you cannot find the relevant fields in the drop-down list. 
*	To keep our records as plete as possible, please submit your information using the attached template(s).
*	The Fifth Row data collection would be pleted by 19 December 2021. Please validate your records after ts date and let us know if there is anytng amiss by 26 December 2021.

 

 

Thank you very much for your co-operation.

 



Office of Student Life

Subject: Sharing of Personal Experience with Scholarships/ Financial Aid/ SUTD Community Grant
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Student,

 

Details about scholarsps and financial matters are usually municated via numbers, tables, sharing the facts and figures. However, we also know that one of the effective ways to share information and facts is through stories that readers can relate to.

 

Therefore, we are reacng out to you to find out more about your personal experience with the various financing options in funding/enricng your studies and student life at SUTD, be it scholarsps, financial aid or SUTD munity Grant for tuition fees, exchange, hostel, etc.  

 

We would really appreciate it if you could reply to a few simple questions listed below.

 

1.	What scholarsp, financial aid or grant did you benefit from?
2.	How did it benefit you?
3.	Please share a story or an experience that ghlights how the scholarsp, financial aid or SUTD munity Grant benefitted you.

 

The information you shared will be inputs for us when developing materials related to scholarsps and financial matters, for example as quotes in brochures and flyers, in social media posts and blog stories. In the process of crafting these materials, we might also e back to you to seek for additional information or materials.

 

Thank you in advance for helping us with ts! Will be great if you could reply with your responses by 17 Nov (Wednesday).

 

,

	
Office of Student Administration

 

 <www.sutd../> 

	
	
8 Somapah Road

Singapore 487372

 <www.facebook/sutdsingapore/>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2F.linkedin%2Fschool%2Fsutd%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cee32e267055c4ea6b33708d9a5cbf9f7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637723117773451023%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1wuyaVBDSOpDvI6p3ClemXW3LZpX09LprKUeHnq8FeQ%3D&reserved=0>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Ftwitter%2Fsutd&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cee32e267055c4ea6b33708d9a5cbf9f7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637723117773461019%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=96DChq3SrBpp4Ewr5Q29mNGk1%2FHnCpezyey2gyyH%2BEQ%3D&reserved=0>    <www.youtube/user/SUTDSingapore>    <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram%2Fsutd%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cee32e267055c4ea6b33708d9a5cbf9f7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637723117773461019%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=3RdkaBQLJ%2BoYSE4V0AyJh%2BndqA5uXtPwVk8hN8lK8%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Batik Mask Self-Collection Booth [18-19 November 2021]
Body:
SUTD,

We have finally received clearance from OSL to book the venue for the: 

BATIK MASK Self-Collection Booth

 

Our booth will be open from 18-19 November 2021 @Campus Centre L2, Outside SUTD Canteen
with the following schles:

 

1st Sft

2nd Sft

Thursday, 18 November 2021

10.00am Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 12.30pm

16.00pm-18.30pm

Friday, 19 November 2021

10.00am Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 12.30pm

-


Do take note that we will be following the Safety Guidelines for General Activities:

*	(WEF 15 Nov) There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities.
*	All students who wish to participate in Fifth Row physical activities are required to perform a weekly self-swab Antigen Rapid Test on every Sunday and submit the test results by 11.59pm via tts.sutd.. .
	
	

For those who missed the opportunity to order our batik masks, ts is your last chance to buy the masks, do take note of the dates and remember to submit your ART test results by ts Sunday!





Have a great weekend ahead,



PADI Exco 2021 Ã°Å¸â€™â€º


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us on our Instagram <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram%2Fpadigraphy&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cc3a538c6e93043cd9cba08d9a5f22e12%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637723282071791052%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ndOOOS06csTXQ34rh9GDLtVhuXJYc3rt2WdoHXJ%2BKm4%3D&reserved=0>  or Email us at indonesiancultural@club.sutd.. <mailindonesiancultural@club.sutd..> !

 participants,

Subject: Request for Quotation
Body:
Sir/Madam, 

 

I am Devans from the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government. My team would like to seek your kind quotation for our event. 

 

We are looking for a simple wte cotton round neck, short sleeve srt with a simple (8cm * 8cm) logo printing in black ink on the sleeve or the front. As we are currently unsure on the potential numbers, we would like to seek 2 separate quotations, 1 for Qty: 300, 1 for Qty: 400. 

 

We would like to check the following details:

1. What is the accepted payment mode?

2. How long is the lead time from confirming the design and number per size to collection? 

3. Is delivery free?

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Devans Jos

Director of Events & Welfare

Subject: Monthly meeting on cohort class matters
Body:
all,

 

The Office of UGS would meet up with the cohort advisors and student reps every month for discussions on cohort class matters. Staff from the OCIF/ AV team / Fab Lab and Library are also invited to join the meetings and to address concerns on academic facilities, AV/IT and library  related matters. We will meet online via Zoom.

 

Below are the date/ time of the meetings for ts term. You will receive the calendar invites and Zoom link soon. Please RSVP your attendance. Thanks.

 

 

Date

Time

17 Nov 2021 (Wed)

230pm to 330pm

10 Dec 2021 (Fri)

2pm to 3pm

	 Sir/Madam, 

	 

	I am Devans from the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government. My team would like to seek your kind quotation for our event. 

	 

	We are looking for a simple wte cotton round neck, short sleeve srt with a simple (8cm * 8cm) logo printing in black ink on the sleeve or the front. As we are currently unsure on the potential numbers, we would like to seek 2 separate quotations, 1 for Qty: 300, 1 for Qty: 400. 

	 

	We would like to check the following details:

	1. What is the accepted payment mode?

	2. How long is the lead time from confirming the design and number per size to collection? 

	3. Is delivery free?

	 

	Yours sincerely,

	 

Devans Jos

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare 

9th Student Government

Subject: Find A Buddy! for mentors to have fun and be rewarded when guiding fellow SUTDents!
Body:
Ts email has been bcc-ed to all students

 

 SUTDents again!

 

DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t miss out on ts opportunity to guide frese international SUTDents on a brand new chapter of their lives. ROOT presents Ã¢â‚¬Å“Find A BuddyÃ¢â‚¬Â, a fun opportunity for you to pair up with international SUTDents! Take a break from your exam preparations and team up with a BUDDY for a game of Bingo that will take you on an adventure all around Singapore and the SUTD Campus !!! DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t forget to take pictures and videos of your adventure along the way. The first 15 pairs to plete the Bingo are to win Gong Cha Vouchers !!! Ts is your sign to expand your social circle and sign up for Ã¢â‚¬Å“Find a BuddyÃ¢â‚¬Â anytime from today till 21st November!!

 

Interested SUTDents mentors can sign up here <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FqhJjMHXRXk&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cbb72841337224f9e053908d9a835b462%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637725771094391365%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=nL1WdOmrRh6hjEFjIoTFYwK2%2BonJvTO7R%2FsqX2DA6sE%3D&reserved=0> . Get paired up with your BUDDY and receive your Bingo sheets by 22nd November. Join us for an opportunity to not only have a fun pass time but also to create a buddy for life! Hope you all are stang safe.

Subject: Find A Buddy! for mentees to have fun and be rewarded while exploring Singapore!
Body:
Ts email has been bcc-ed to all students

 

 SUTDents!

 

We undersd the changing safety measures and not being able to see our family and most friends can cause us to feel apathetic and detached. DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t worry, ROOT presents Ã¢â‚¬Å“Find A BuddyÃ¢â‚¬Â, a fun opportunity for you to pair up with senior SUTDents! Take a break from your exam preparations and team up with a BUDDY for a game of Bingo that will take you on an adventure all around Singapore and the SUTD Campus !!! DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t forget to take pictures and videos of your adventure along the way. The first 15 pairs to plete the Bingo are to win Gong Cha Vouchers !!! Ts is your sign to expand your social circle and sign up for Ã¢â‚¬Å“Find a BuddyÃ¢â‚¬Â from today until 21st November !!

Subject: [Restricted] [2021522] Acceptance of Students@Part-Time Work Scheme Application Form submission
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

  ,

We have received your application form for the engagement with Office of International Relations. Below are the engagement details:

ring Department

Office of International Relations

Job Description and brief description of work

Videos for virtual FACT Programme 2021

Start date

November 2021

End date

January 2022


You may start your engagement with the department on the mentioned dates above. 

Do take note that there are maximum hours that you are allowed to work during term time and vacation period. Also, in accordance with the Employment Act, breaks are required for certain number of hours worked.  

Students working for multiple departments are to bine the work done for each month in ONE timesheet. Students are to submit separate requests (via CONCUR) for each department that work has been done for using the same timesheet.

Please familiarize yourself with the Terms and Conditions of the Students@Part-Time Work Scheme in the Application Form wch can be viewed at the following link www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme <www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme> . 

You may download the timesheet and user guide for the Concur submission from the above-mentioned website. 

Do note that students serving Leave of Absence are not allowed to work under the Scheme. Please inform Office of International Relations as soon as possible if you are on Leave of Absence and to cease your work engagement with the department immediately.  

Thank you and wisng you a great day ahead.

 

,
Norimah
Office of Student Life

 Bee Foong, 

 

As the Term 3 students have math test on Wednesday 2.30-4.30pm, do excuse Issac, Arman and myself for the 17 November meeting. Really sorry about it! 

 

Also, can I check on how Term 3 classes can claim the $250? As most people are not aware about it, many haven't use it yet. Also, is it possible to use the fund to Grab bubble tea for all to drink after class since it is individually packed. 

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 Monthly meeting on cohort class matters 

 

 all,

 

The Office of UGS would meet up with the cohort advisors and student reps every month for discussions on cohort class matters. Staff from the OCIF/ AV team / Fab Lab and Library are also invited to join the meetings and to address concerns on academic facilities, AV/IT and library  related matters. We will meet online via Zoom.

 

Below are the date/ time of the meetings for ts term. You will receive the calendar invites and Zoom link soon. Please RSVP your attendance. Thanks.

 

 

Date

Time

17 Nov 2021 (Wed)

230pm to 330pm

10 Dec 2021 (Fri)

2pm to 3pm

 

Thanks.



Bee Foong

Subject: Request for Quotation
Body:
External Email Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

 Devans,

Could we confirm the details for your order so we can estimate a quotation for you.

300/400pcs, roundneck, cotton
Front: Logo size, 1 color
Back: -

Are the details above correct? (For logo printing either on sleeve or on front chest, pricing wise is the same)

1) Payment methods: PayNow, bank transfer, Cheque, Cash. (Usually for SUTD we issue 30days PO)
2) A safe gauge of the lead time would be 1month upon confirmation of sample.
3) Free delivery, for orders above 100pcs.

We also have free sample for orders above 100pcs. So for you order before we proceed with the main batch we can provide you with a sample.

Could we also get your contact information so we can liaise VIA WhatsApp instead. 

For more enquiries feel free to contact me at the undersigned. 

Sales Executive
Yew Kee
+65 91261321

		 Sir/Madam, 

		 

		I am Devans from the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government. My team would like to seek your kind quotation for our event. 

		 

		We are looking for a simple wte cotton round neck, short sleeve srt with a simple (8cm * 8cm) logo printing in black ink on the sleeve or the front. As we are currently unsure on the potential numbers, we would like to seek 2 separate quotations, 1 for Qty: 300, 1 for Qty: 400. 

		 

		We would like to check the following details:

		1. What is the accepted payment mode?

		2. How long is the lead time from confirming the design and number per size to collection? 

		3. Is delivery free?

		 

		Yours sincerely,

		 

Devans Jos

 Monthly meeting on cohort class matters

 

 all,

 

The Office of UGS would meet up with the cohort advisors and student reps every month for discussions on cohort class matters. Staff from the OCIF/ AV team / Fab Lab and Library are also invited to join the meetings and to address concerns on academic facilities, AV/IT and library  related matters. We will meet online via Zoom.

 

Below are the date/ time of the meetings for ts term. You will receive the calendar invites and Zoom link soon. Please RSVP your attendance. Thanks.

 

 

Date

Time

17 Nov 2021 (Wed)

230pm to 330pm

10 Dec 2021 (Fri)

2pm to 3pm

 

Thanks.



Bee Foong

Subject: Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD
Body:
External Email Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

 , 

Sincere apologies on the very late response, as I was away for a month plus. 

I've looked through your proposal & email. 
After discussing with my team, we would like to suggest that the program be conducted online via Zoom instead.

In view of the Covid situation & the safe management measures, we've a limited number of volunteers wch we can allow into our centre, & t have to do the ART & declaration. Also, our cldren can only be in pairs, in accordance to the measures given by MSF.

Please let me know if converting the programme to online is feasible for you & your team. Alternatively, we can explore postponing ts to next year when more measures are eased.

Looking forward to hearing from you!
Thank you. 

,
Geraldine Woon 
Program Coordinator
Sunsne Club Student Care Centre
6645 0736/ 6645 0737

	 Geraldine Woon <geraldinewoon@bethesdacare.>
	  Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD 
	 
	 Geraldine,  

	Sorry for the late follow up on the event. Our school has approved the event and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re good to go! IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve attached the proposal in the email. 

	With  to the materials, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve got some budget to get fairy lights, batteries, translucent paper, colour paper and wrapping paper. Students will just need to bring cereal boxes, as well as washed and cleaned milk cartons. For the other materials, does the care centre provide? 

	After much discussions, we felt that groups of 2 or conducting online will not be ideal for hands-on craft. As such, we are hoping that the COVID-19 situation mild down by December so we can organise it in groups of 5. In the case the situation remains, we would like to check on how lessons are conducted currently so we could replicate similar SMM for our event.

	Lastly, we would be conducting 2 separate sessions for P3 and P4 students respectively, with each session being 2 hours long, on any date between 20-23 December 2024. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re hoping to have the event in a single day, with one session earlier in the day wle the other one will be afterwards. Do feel free to suggest a date and arrangement that suit the classes best. 

	Feel free to clarify any queries. Thank you!

	With Love,

	 

 

 <root.sutd../>

	  Jun Ping <junping@bethesdacare.>; Mandy  <mandy@bethesdacare.>; Student - Mohamad Arshad S/O Khaja Moinudeen <mohamad_arshad>; Student - Teo Jiawen <jiawen_teo>; Student - Lim Shu Hui Pamela <pamela_lim>
	  Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD 
	 
	External Email Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

	 

	 ,

	Thank you for looking into ts program! I've taken note of the tentative dates from 20-24 December 2021, we can finalise the date when more details are being firmed up.

	The P3 & P4 class size is 21 pax & 13 pax respectively. On our end, we are alright for the on-site engagement to still carry on with ts age group, though unvaccinated. 
	Thank you for giving us the assurance that your team will be fully vaccinated by then!

	Looking at the current cases & safe discing measures, it is good to have an online schle planned out like what your team initiated. 
	In view of that, may I please suggest that your team propose a cut-off date for us to make a decision on whether we should proceed with an on-site or online program regardless of future changes in the safe discing measures? Ts is to ensure that there is sufficient time for both parties adjust the program & getting the attendance of the cldren.

	The general safe discing measures that we have in our centre as of now a
	
	- No more than 5 pax per group for activities/discussion, including students & volunteer 
	- Classes of different levels are not allowed to mingle 
	- To try our best to maintain 1 metre disce between individuals & groups 

	As the detailed safe discing measures may change frequently, above are some basic general guidelines for us to follow. If there is anytng else to add on along the way, I will keep you updated. Hope ts clarifies!

	Please feel free to contact me if more clarification is needed! Thank you.
	
	, 
	Geraldine Woon 
	Program Coordinator
	Sunsne Club Student Care Centre
	6645 0736/ 6645 0737

	 Geraldine Woon <geraldinewoon@bethesdacare.>
	  Jun Ping <junping@bethesdacare.>; Mandy  <mandy@bethesdacare.>; Student - Mohamad Arshad S/O Khaja Moinudeen <mohamad_arshad>; Student - Teo Jiawen <jiawen_teo>; Student - Lim Shu Hui Pamela <pamela_lim>
	  Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD 
	 

	 Geraldine,  

	 

	ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s some really great news! Looking forward to working with your team.  

	 

	After much discussion with my team, we are likely to organize the program on either of these dates, 20-24 December 2021, after our finals examination. In addition, we are looking into designing the program for P3 and/or P4 students. A query we have would be that is it possible to plan activities for ts age group, as t cannot be vaccinated? If possible, may we know the cohort size for P3 and P4 respectively? If itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not encouraged, would changing our target group to above 12 years old be more suitable? On our side, please rest assured that my team will be fully vaccinated by then.  

	 

	As much as we love to organize an on-site activity, we would plan an online schle as well in case of any sudden wave of infection (touchwood!). Is it possible to share with us some safe management measures that you observe so that we can include similar measures in the proposal?  

	 

	Thank you so much and hope to hear from you soon!  

	 

	Have a great day!  

	 
	<

Subject: Access to stationery vending machines
Body:
Stationery Reps,

 

Wele on board to the Student Exco mittee. We are granting access to 1 stationery rep of each cohort class to access the vending macnes at Blk 1 Level 3, Level 4 and Level 5 for stationery. Kindly email me the full name, your cohort class and the 16 digit nos at the back of your student card. We will collate all the card nos and inform you once access is granted.  We will grant the access once all stationery reps have replied. Meanwle if you urgently need stationery please email me.

 

Thanks.



Bee Foong

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: [Restricted] [2021524] Acceptance of Students@Part-Time Work Scheme Application Form submission
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

  ,

We have received your application form for the engagement with Office of Admissions. Below are the engagement details:

ring Department

Office of Admissions

Job Description and brief description of work

The Upcycling Project Planning and Executing A380 Airbus Exbition in SUTD

Start date

November 2021

End date

January 2022


You may start your engagement with the department on the mentioned dates above. 

Do take note that there are maximum hours that you are allowed to work during term time and vacation period. Also, in accordance with the Employment Act, breaks are required for certain number of hours worked.  

Students working for multiple departments are to bine the work done for each month in ONE timesheet. Students are to submit separate requests (via CONCUR) for each department that work has been done for using the same timesheet.

Please familiarize yourself with the Terms and Conditions of the Students@Part-Time Work Scheme in the Application Form wch can be viewed at the following link www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme <www.sutd../Campus-Life/Student-Life/Students@Part-Time-Work-Scheme> . 

You may download the timesheet and user guide for the Concur submission from the above-mentioned website. 

Do note that students serving Leave of Absence are not allowed to work under the Scheme. Please inform Office of Admissions as soon as possible if you are on Leave of Absence and to cease your work engagement with the department immediately.  

Thank you and wisng you a great day ahead.

 

,
Norimah
Office of Student Life

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare 

9th Student Government

Unwavering Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Accountable Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Collaborative

Body:
Warm greetings from SenseTime Overseas HR Team. 

SenseTime's Overseas Campus Recruitment 2022- Live Webinar is ing up on 19 NOV 2021 (Ts Friday). 

Our senior AI leaders and new-gen R&D talents are going to share their firsthand experience as well as SenseTime campus recruitment tips with all local and overseas students. 

Hope to offering an exclusive opportunity for them to embark their new journey in AI, greatly appreciate if you could share ts event with students &  2022 graduates to know more about SenseTime and 150+ grad jobs & internsp opportunities are waiting for them to get onboard the AI <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2F%3Fkeywords%3Dai%26ghlightpdateUrns%3Durn%253Ali%253Aactivity%253A6856455300057329664&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C4ddb66df25e14852813408d9a97e2af4%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637727181717279860%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=5TEh4QJ96SdE1OR555zWtkPq%2BoibDhm7JJdgc6vhn%2Fo%3D&reserved=0>  journey with us around the world (Hong Kong, Mainland Cna, Taiwan, Macau, Japan, Singapore, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Malaysia, South Korea, Thailand, Indonesia, Plippines, etc.)!  Notes of meeting on cohort class matters - 17 Nov 2021

 

 all,

 

Thank you for attending the meeting ts afternoon. Attached are the slides for your reference. 

 

Following are the notes of discussion:

 

Class funds

-          Each cohort class is given $300 class fund for Term 1 and $300 class fund for Term 2. The unutilised amount for Term 1 can be carry forward to Term 2. However unutilised amount in Term 1 and 2 cannot be carry forward to Term 3. Students are advised to use the full amount of class fund  i.e $600 by the end of Term 2. There would not be any class fund in Term 3.

-          The process for class fund claims is as follows:

1. Students to seek approval  from staff/ faculty cohort advisors on the usage of class fund and purchase of items.

2.Students to pay for the items and obtain the receipts.
3.Students to submit the receipts, class fund utilisation form and email approval from cohort advisor when submitting their claims in Concur system at www.concursolutions/ <www.concursolutions/> . Please refer to the first slide attachment for more details on claims submission in Concur.

 

Trainings for Student Reps

-          The respective department staff will be organising training sessions for the AV reps, Library reps,  3D printers Reps  and First Aid reps . Students are informed to keep a lookout for the emails and RSVP on their availability for the training sessions.

 

3D Printers

-          There would not be any 3D printers in the cohort classrooms. Students can access Fab Lab if t want to use the 3D printers.

 

AV/IT Matters

-          Students are reminded to shut down the AV system after class.

-          Max informed  that the AV control panels are not mounted on the lecturer console tables  in  Term 3 TTs 1.410, 1.510 and 2.607. Ts may cause damage to the panels. We will follow up with OCIF and AV  on ts matter.

 

Import Contact Nos

-          To report facilities related problems, please email Help Facilities at help-facilities@sutd.. <mailhelp-facilities@sutd..>  or call 63036699.

-          To report AV/IT related problems, please email IT Service Desk at help-it@sutd.. <mailhelp-it@sutd..>  or call 64994500.

Please refer to the notice put up in your cohort classrooms for other import contact nos.

 

If you have any other queries on academic facilities you can email us at Spaces@sutd.. <mailSpaces@sutd..> .

 

Thanks.



Bee Foong

Subject: Dialogue with Senior Management (Fall 2021)
Body:
SUTDents!

 

We will be having our virtual DSM tomorrow on 19 Nov 3pm to 5:30pm. It will be livestreamed on Youtube so you guys will be able to watch and ask questions in real time. The link will be sent tomorrow. We will be covering topics that were indicated in the pre-DSM form that you guys have filled up. Do tune in and watch in your pockets of free time! On a side note, good job to those who have pleted their exams ts week!

  Dialogue with Senior Management (Fall 2021)

 SUTDents!

 

Thank you for those who have filled up the form! For those who have not, do fill up the form by 31 Oct 2359. It is a form that prises mostly rating questions so it would not take up much time Ã°Å¸ËœÆ’ Again, the responses will be kept anonymous and t will be used in the uping DSM for a more substiated discussion. The form can be accessed via ts link: forms.office/r/L3YACG1tFi <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FL3YACG1tFi&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C506e0296381449e98f7e08d9aa2de178%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637727936665434839%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=UYV%2B6%2FLOswidwmaJqSpO5cSjgl9bI95tKZqZVGCts%3D&reserved=0>  The DSM is schled to be held on 19 Nov 3pm Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 5:30pm and more information will be released closer to date so do look out for it.  Student Government - Student Relations 
 Tuesday, 26 October 2021 2:51 pm
 Student Government - President <president@studentgov.sutd..>
 Student Government - Events <events@studentgov.sutd..>
 Dialogue with Senior Management (Fall 2021)

 

 SUTDents!

 

Hope you guys are stang safe and enjong your recess week (: ROOT will be organizing its biannual Dialogue with Senior Management and we would like your help in facilitating the discussion. So, what is DSM? DSM is an event for the SUTD munity to discuss the concerns that students are facing and how we can work with the Senior Management to address them. 

 

The feedback collected from the Telegram Bot and GRASS survey have been sorted and we would like to build upon it to provide a more substiated discussion during the DSM. As such, please do take the time to fill up ts short form (forms.office/r/L3YACG1tFi <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FL3YACG1tFi&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C506e0296381449e98f7e08d9aa2de178%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637727936665444829%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=qLUdFGaElSiCS4Lj62bOLCfETcJ%2BvWx3pVC%2F1FqwYbE%3D&reserved=0> ) wch will provide us with the content and information we will be using for the uping DSM. More information about the DSM will be released in Week 8 so do look out for it! Thank you for your time and enjoy the rest of your recess week!

 

Darren Teng

Subject: Infographics for Sept 2021 Subject Enrolment Exercise Survey
Body:
SUTD Family,

As the Cabinet of the 9th SUTD Student Government and 5th SAC, it has been our mitment to listen to your concerns and feedback. We undersd that the Subject Enrolment Exercise process is a topic that many students are concerned about, that is why we started working with the Office of IT and Office of Student Admin (OSA) back from January 2021, up till now. 

There have since been 2 Subject Enrolment Exercises in May and Sept 2021 and through working with OIT, OSA and, also collecting students' feedback from surveys, we were glad that there has been much improvement to the Subject Enrolment Exercise experience. We would like to share a few key results from the 6th September Subject Enrolment Exercise Survey and, also the progress that we have made so far.

Our work is far from done. The Student Government are mitted to continuing our work with OIT and OSA to improve the Subject Enrolment Exercise. We will continue to collect feedback from students via surveys regarding the Subject Enrolment Exercise.

On that note, Dialogue with Senior Management (DSM) will be happening on 19th November (Friday), 3pm via YouTube Live Stream. Our DSM Planning Team will be sharing the DSM YouTube Live Steam Link shortly. Do join us in our Dialogue with Senior Management to share any other concerns that you have and listen in to various sharing and announcements by our SUTD Senior Management.


Thank you! 




,
Pheh Jing Jie 
	 <root.sutd../> 	 
Vice-President (Operations)	 
9th Student Government

Subject: 2021 September Term - 10.022 : Modelling Uncertainty: Modelling Uncertainty Week 11
Body:
students,

Here is the format for Modelling Uncertainty during Week 11:

- No new content will be introduced in Week 11. (Week 12 class 1 slides, wch may be relevant to the 2D project, will be released during Week 11.)

- There will only be 1 class in Week 11. That class will be unstructured, and the purpose of it is for you to ask your instructors any questions about the 2D.

- For F02, F03, F09, F10, that class will be the second class of the week. For everyone else, it will be the first class of the week.

In other words: for F01, F04, F05, F06, F08, F11: it will be the Tuesday class; for F07: the Wednesday class; for F02, F03, F09, F10: the Thursday class.

- I will upload some tips/guidelines about the 2D on eDimension over the weekend.

Best wishes,

James

 there,

It's easier to be productive when you're using the right tool for the job. Power tools can be useful for heavy-duty tasks, but sometimes all you need is a hammer.

That's why we're excited to introduce simple tables Ã¢â‚¬â€ a top feature request from the Notion munity! Use them when you need to organize information in your notes & docs, but don't need all the bells & wstles of a database.

 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fe.customeriomail%2Fe%2Fc%2FeyJlbWFpbF9pZCI6IlJPX1lCUU1BQVgwMENzN3haWUxaMVI4b0k2TmFndz09IiwiaHJlZiI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lm5vdGlvbi5zby9ndWlkZXMvc2ltcGxlLXRhYmxlcy12cy1kYXRhYmFzZXM_%2Fa9de09a77c573a7cbae8018c1d9f8247c0fb4d6a11d65781d51c8fcb8b0b82ac&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C68095c752ea74fa95e5508d9aabb6136%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637728544040397912%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=klTDEFHEAtvBzxwGdrJEFUm0tWnHz3BS9%2B%2BMTP8%2Flz0%3D&reserved=0> 


*	Add a simple table to your page by typing /table 
*	Drag the bottom right corner to make as many rows and columns as you need
*	Use the Turn into database button if you need to add filters, custom views or other advanced features

Learn more


And simple tables aren't the only new tool in your toolbox:

*	New template gallery: Discover 200+ pre-built setups for every need, from product roadmapping & design systems to curated template collections like the new Startup OS. Message Classification: [Restricted]

 

 students

Office of Student Life

Subject: Safe Management Measures in the hostel (22nd November 2021)
Body:
Resident,

In accordance with the latest COVID-19 advisories from the various government agencies on 9th October 2021, Residents are advised to take note of the latest Safe Management Measures (SMM) effective 22nd November 2021 wlst residing in the hostel. 

Changes to Safe Management Measures (SMM)

With effect from 11th October 2021, students issued with Health Risk Warning (HRW) may only return to campus after a negative ART Result. You must do an ART self-test once a day before leaving your room during the 7-day HRW period.

Group sizes may go up to 5 pax. Residents are strongly encouraged to interact witn the same group of up to 5 residents and avoid mingling with other groups where possible. Masks are to be work throughout the interactions.

With effect from Monday, 13th October 2021, residents to dine alone when consuming F&B in Hostel munal Spaces.

Please refer to the following for the latest SMM.

1.    Daily Declaration - Residents are required to submit a daily health declaration thru tts.sutd.. <tts.sutd../> .

2.    Feeling Unwell Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Residents with gh temperature (37.6 degrees Celsius or more) or who are unwell should see a doctor immediately. T are to update their Resident Life Coordinator (RLC) if t have been tested for COVID-19. RLCs may be contacted at 9720 9316 (Melissa) / 9230 3853 (Peggy) / 9296 2691 (Chalit).  COVID-19 test results must also be reported immediately to the RLCs.

3.    Carry Your ID - Please always carry your Student ID and room card with you as hostel and campus security officers will be conducting identity checks. Residents who do not produce these cards will not be allowed to enter the hostel and may be denied entry to other parts of campus.

4.    Entering Hostel - You may enter the hostel only via level 2. All other hostel access points (including those at level 1) will be disabled until further notice. Residents found entering the hostel through access points other than the designated level 2 entry points will be subject to disciplinary action.

5.    No Visitors Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Visitors are not allowed witn the hostel (Ã¢â‚¬ËœvisitorsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ are defined as persons who do not live in the hostel and may include SUTD staff, students & alumni).

6.    Wear a Mask Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do wear a mask the moment you leave your room for any purpose. The mask may be temporarily removed only during strenuous exercises and during meals.

7.    Gathering in Rooms Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Only 1 cross-room visitor (residents only) is allowed per hostel resident. Residents are still required to wear a mask & maintain at least a 1-metre safe discing when having visitors.

8.    Group Gatherings Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Group gatherings must be kept to a maximum of 5 persons at any given time. You must dine alone. 

Residents are strongly encouraged to limit their gatherings to 1 per day (including cross-room visits).  Safe discing measures are to always be observed.

9.    Safe Discing Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not sit on the marked-out seats. Please adhere to capacity limits of the munal facilities and maintain at least a 1-metre disce from each other.

10.  Safe Entry Ã¢â‚¬â€œ ONLY Trace Together App or Token may be used for entry into SUTD via Campus Centre Level 1, Lobby F Level 1 or Sports and Recreation Centre (SRC). Do check in at these locations.

Please remember to bring along your token or mobile with Safe Entry (SE) app whenever you leave your room. Ts is to aid contact tracing, when necessary, by the authorities.

11.  Check in Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Please do a Safe Entry check in, every time you return to campus

12.  TraceTogether Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Remember to bring along your TraceTogether token or mobile with TraceTogether app whenever you leave your hostel room.

13.  Health Risk Warning Ã¢â‚¬â€œ With effect from 11th October 2021, students issued with Health Risk Warning (HRW) may only return to campus after a negative ART Result. You must do an ART self-test once a day before leaving your room during the 7-day HRW period.

 

Residents should continue (for entire period of HRW or HRA) to limit their social interactions, monitor their health, and see a doctor promptly if t feel unwell 

 

14.  Sporting Facilities Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Only users in pliance with the Vaccination-differentiated SMMs (VDS) are allowed to use the facilities.

 

Let us play our part to keep our friends, loved ones and ourselves safe during ts trng period. 

 

,
Office of Housing

 

Block 59, #01-91
Changi South Avenue 1, Singapore 485999

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cf71d83c8dafc4a86bda808d9ad53413a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637731395345065572%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=JWDP8b3%2BN6Tuh0ErlZjEmu4INEOprVbtvQEmTtSA5MU%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

Subject: Request for Quotation
Body:
Sir/Madam, 

 

I am Devans from the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government. My team would like to seek your kind quotation for our event. 

 

We are looking for a simple wte cotton round neck, short sleeve srt with a simple (8cm * 8cm) logo printing in black ink on the sleeve or the front. As we are currently unsure on the potential numbers, we would like to seek 2 separate quotations, 1 for Qty: 300, 1 for Qty: 400. Could you please provide a formal quotation in the form of a document or pdf in order to seek approval.

 

We would like to check the following details:

1. What is the accepted payment mode?

2. How long is the lead time from confirming the design and number per size to collection? 

3. Is delivery free?

 

Yours sincerely,

 

Devans Jos

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare 

9th Student Government

Unwavering Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Accountable Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Collaborative

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C5c88b64bf83e4534aa2908d9adc933c0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637731901945666740%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=V8rdSy2hnWV4%2FXEjLmsxW%2Fm0uPVZrZqyKdQEUfukw%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C6db0840d08a34625e19e08d9ad9c871b%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637731710064730572%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=iW5gTBde%2FScKFyj41YEfTSimycI3qpRFl2zpYxmmQM0%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C86d765932f144537f30208d9ad9a340d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637731700087034728%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=8zov0yEhVKIRE0jW8dTzY6rBNKNFXEYOqk7oQFM9%2BYQ%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare

 Enquiry on a collaboration

 

 Anthony,

 

I am  from Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government (ROOT). As Christmas approaches, we would like to organise a fundraising event in December to give back to the society. I came across the Cldren-At-Risk Empowerment Association (CARE Singapore) page on giving. and would like to ask if a collaboration is possible. 

 

One of our school clubs has done similar collaboration with NKF by setting up a giving. exclusively for SUTD students. Here's the link <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.giving.%2Fcampaigns%2Fsutdrotaract-project-renal&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C4615cc8d31d04bd3fb4608d9af21f4f0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637733385770188673%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0&sdata=gvSoOLZo7WbnYJJcfRJOk3374S8mZeBjqFkzadSJ8z0%3D&reserved=0>  for a reference. If you're keen for a collaboration, is it possible if you could set a project and share the link with us? We would tnk that $5, $10, $15, $20, and $50 would be affordable range for students.

 

Feel free to call me at 97705194 for more discussion. Hope to hear from you soon.

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare

Subject: Enquiry on a setting up a campaign
Body:
External Email Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

 ,

 

Thank you for writing in to us. Here is some brief background information about CldrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Wisng Well (CWW):

 

We are a registered charity founded in 2002, and the only charity organisation in Singapore focused on the holistic cation of cldren and youth from disadvantaged backgrounds. Our cldren e from low-ine families, and their parents may be ill, incarcerated, or absent from their lives. We provide a broad range of services to them 100% free-of-charge. Our programmes support their current cational and daily living needs, as well as equip them with skills for their future, so as to empower them to escape the poverty trap. An introduction to CWW is attached for your reference. Just to clarify, we are not an orphanage. Hope that ts is still in alignment with you.

 

We would love to collaborate on a fundraising initiative, thanks for keeping us in mindÃ°Å¸ËœÅ  Yes sure, I can help to set up the campaign. Would you like to let us know what content you prefer; including the goal and campaign period?

 Enquiry on a setting up a campaign

 Sir/Madam, 

 

I am  from Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government (ROOT). As Christmas approaches, we would like to organise a fundraising event in December to give back to the society. I came across the Cldren's Wisng Well page on giving. and would like to ask if a collaboration is possible. 

 

One of our school clubs has done similar collaboration with NKF by setting up a giving. exclusively for SUTD students. Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

Subject: EPF: Freshnomore Event
Body:
,

 

You may proceed with the giving tsrt part of the EPF.

 

 

EPF Status: Approved In-Principle

*	You may proceed with the tsrt part of the EPF.
*	As for the donation, ts is pending review since details have yet to be shared.
*	Please see following sections for details.

 

Finance

*	Noted that there will be no ine for ts event.
	
*	Please refer to the Student Organisation Finance guidelines at root.sutd../ <root.sutd../>  for more information.
*	Procurement and expenditure

	*	Prepare 3 quotations for purchases that are $300 and above.
	*	Request vendors to issue invoice as far as possible to rce the need of student claims.
	*	Payment mode:

		*	Vendor invoice:

			*	Please seek approval via hardcopy Purchase Request Form or Purchase Award Form before any purchase.
			*	Please email the softcopy Invoice and supporting documents to studentlife@sutd.. <mailstudentlife@sutd..>  for processing.

		*	Student claim:

			*	Please submit Purchase Request via Concur system before any purchase.
			*	Please refer to OSL Students Organisation Concur Guide for more information.
			*	Hardcopy documents for student claim will no longer be accepted.

 

Declaration of Personal Data Collection

*	Noted that you will not be collecting any personal data for the event.

 

Poster

*	Please submit the poster for our review regarding the donation.

 

Access to campus (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 1 Dec. 
*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus. (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)
*	We will update you on the students access status by 6 Dec after verification on the ART testing results.

 

Photos

*	Please inform participants that photos and videos will be taken throughout the event for reporting and publicity purposes.
*	Please take photos of the event. (for online activity, screenshots are acceptable)

	*	Activity photos
	*	Group photos

 

Post Event Submission

*	After-Action Review

	*	Please submit the following to us by 30 Jan 2022 (Sun).

		*	Brief details of response and feedback
		*	Number of attendance
		*	Any interesting, pertinent points?
		*	6 photos 

 

,

Crystal

 Crystal,

 

Sorry for the unclear message. So, we will be proceeding with the t-srt purchase and give it out to the whole cohort for free with the Class of 2024 measurements. Ts is because we wish to make the event inclusive for all and not want anyone to feel left out because of the $2 fee.

 

To pensate for that, we wish to do a charity for Christmas as a batch. So, instead of pang $2 for the srts, we will share a donation link to the Class of 2024 as a token from out batch to the society ts festive season. Ts will be optional for all, with no restriction to donation amount and out of goodwill only. 

 

Hope ts clarifies.

 

Yours sincerely,

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

Body:
External Email Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 



 



 

 Nicodemus, 

 

Thank you and your team, Team WorkGround, for participating in the Samsung Solve for Tomorrow 2021 petition. We are encouraged by the gh quality, creative ideas we have received from the teams ts year.

 

After careful consideration and difficult deliberation, we regret to inform you that your team was not selected for the Shortlist phase. We appreciate your time, effort, and teamwork in developing your ideas. 

 

We hope you will continue to pursue your ideas and passion, and keep working to build a better tomorrow. 

 

Thank you again for your support. We wish you the very best in your future endeavours.

 

,

 

 

H.K. Bian | Project Manager

Career Tips & Advice	
	
a



 





	


4 Writing Mistakes You Don't Know You're Making Most jobs require strong writing skills now that email and Slack are the primary ways to municate with clients and colleagues. And even before you begin a job, you need to write well. You need to write resumes, cover letters, thank-you letters, networking letters, emails to ring managers and recruiters. Without strong writing skills, you might never get the job you want. You might never get the chance to email clients and colleagues. Read more <firsthand.co/blogs/workplace-issues/4-writing-mistakes-you-dont-know-youre-making>

Thank you for writing in to us. Here is some brief background information about CldrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Wisng Well (CWW):

 

We are a registered charity founded in 2002, and the only charity organisation in Singapore focused on the holistic cation of cldren and youth from disadvantaged backgrounds. Our cldren e from low-ine families, and their parents may be ill, incarcerated, or absent from their lives. We provide a broad range of services to them 100% free-of-charge. Our programmes support their current cational and daily living needs, as well as equip them with skills for their future, so as to empower them to escape the poverty trap. An introduction to CWW is attached for your reference. Just to clarify, we are not an orphanage. Hope that ts is still in alignment with you.

 

We would love to collaborate on a fundraising initiative, thanks for keeping us in mindÃ°Å¸ËœÅ  Yes sure, I can help to set up the campaign. Would you like to let us know what content you prefer; including the goal and campaign period?

 Enquiry on a setting up a campaign

 

	CAUTION: Ts email originated from outside your organisation. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognise the sender and know the content is safe. 

 

 Sir/Madam, 

 

I am  from Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) Student Government (ROOT). As Christmas approaches, we would like to organise a fundraising event in December to give back to the society. I came across the Cldren's Wisng Well page on giving. and would like to ask if a collaboration is possible. 

 

One of our school clubs has done similar collaboration with NKF by setting up a giving. exclusively for SUTD students. Here's the link <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fwww.giving.%2Fcampaigns%2Fsutdrotaract-project-renal&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cb83eff3ac8914adebd9e08d9b08db98f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637734945348987896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0&sdata=X5GmGFQLSwglIi0mQe3gFKbrk3XqRJ6B12ZiU4fD438%3D&reserved=0>  for a reference. If you're keen for a collaboration, is it possible if you could set a campaign and share the link with us? We would tnk that $5, $10, $20, $50, and $100 would be affordable range for students.

 

Feel free to call me at 97705194 for more discussion. Hope to hear from you soon.

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Froot.sutd..%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7Cb83eff3ac8914adebd9e08d9b08db98f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637734945348987896%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0&sdata=%2FAC24xFV7mt12HYJ7GbRPx2lIbxnaclewrJqq9SAQeo%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Submission of 2D
Body:
Alright thanks! If it's still not past the deadline, probably should take note of the following:

*	5 pages doesn't include the cover page, so you can still include 1 more page worth of stuff
*	probably shouldn't report all the significant figures, but always to 3sf unless more accuracy is useful (as in lack of sf will give some difference)

Subject: UTOP Outstanding UTA Award Fall 2021!
Body:
<apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FbDaatSbLkL&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C8e2866445c514979fe2c08d9b0bb4aeb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637735140860024516%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=nkPTOXO%2B7I4FKKT2uqELUfVsWZrqBzOIO9e8DiOqQys%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 Faculty and Students,

 

UTOP OUTSDING UTA AWARD NOMINATION IS NOW OPEN!

 

Ts award is to acknowledge and recognize outsding undergraduate teacng assists (UTA) under the Undergraduate Teacng Opportunities Programme (UTOP). 

 

If you know of a UTOP UTA who,

 

*	Exbits innovative pedagogical/instructional techniques
*	Contributes significantly to student learning
*	Mentors students/participants
*	Shows evidence of self-improvement efforts to advance s/her teacng techniques 
*	Demonstrates other outsding traits 

You can nominate m/her by pleting the nomination form he forms.office/r/bDaatSbLkL <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fforms.office%2Fr%2FbDaatSbLkL&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C8e2866445c514979fe2c08d9b0bb4aeb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637735140860024516%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=nkPTOXO%2B7I4FKKT2uqELUfVsWZrqBzOIO9e8DiOqQys%3D&reserved=0>  

 

There will be one award each semester to the most outsding UTA that term.

 

Nomination letters should address the selection criteria stated above.  Specific examples in the form would be helpful in promoting your nominee!

 

Nomination Criteria

Nominees must be:

 

1.	A Undergraduate TA under the UTOP programme
2.	Have served in the 2021 Fall semester witn the period of Sep to Dec 2021.
3.	Not a student instructor from a student-initiated project. 

Nominators must:

 

1.	Have direct experience as a student/participant under the UTA
2.	Staff/Faculty who is a direct supervisor of the UTA who has observed the teacng of the Nominee

 

Nominations will end on 17 Dec 2021!

 

Successful nominees may be invited for an interview with us.

 

--- 

 

We will also have a UTOP Long Service Award to recognize dedicated UTOPers who have performed reasonably well and have served in UTOP for 5 and more times!

 

--- 

 

For more information, you can contact us at utop@sutd.. <mailutop@sutd..>    

 

Inspired by your UTOP UTA? Nominate m/her today!

 



Huang Weilin (Ms)

Undergraduate Research and Teacng Opportunities Programme

Office of Undergraduate Studies (3.702)

D: +65 6499 4526

Subject: Conversation on SUTD Sustainability Plan
Body:
all,

 

Reference to the attached invitation from the Office of Provost. Just a gentle reminder to RSVP your attendance with Ms Sharon Yeo (cc in ts email) on the  dialogue session on 1 Dec , 5pm if you have not done so. 

 

We look forward to your participation in the session.

 

Thanks.



Bee Foong

 

 Lim Bee Foong

 Conversation on SUTD Sustainability Plan

 

 all,

 

The University would like to invite all  Reps for a dialogue session on SUTD Sustainability Plan. The session is organised by the Office of Provost. Please refer to the attached for more details on the content for the dialogue session.  We hope you could find time to attend the session and your feedback will greatly benefit the university. Ms Sharon Yeo (Copied in ts email), organiser of the session,  has sent you an invitation. Kindly RSVP to her.

 

Thanks. 

 

 



Bee Foong

Subject: EPF: ROOT A Collage Network
Body:
To Kadir,

 

Noted with thanks for the information. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve attached the list of the organising mittee and the participants in ts email. I would like to inform that the participants who are putting up and taking down the wteboards will be the same.  Thank you.

 

,

Cheng Wei Xuan

 

 Suharti Abdul Kadir <suharti_abdul@sutd..> 
 Saturday, 27 November 2021 11:06
 Student - Cheng Wei Xuan <weixuan_cheng>; Student Government - Events <events@studentgov.sutd..>
 Student -  ,  <_>; Student - Lim Shu Hui Pamela <pamela_lim>; Yeo Lay Pheng <laypheng_yeo@sutd..>; Siti Radah Binti Hamzah <siti_radah@sutd..>; Crystal Qua <crystal_qua@sutd..>
  EPF: ROOT A Collage Network

 

 Wei Xuan 

 

EPF Status: Approved 

*	We have no issues with the event.

 

Physical Wteboard 

*	OCIF has given the clearance to put up the wteboards for the T1 classroom doors. 
*	Please ensure that the wteboards are removed by 17 Dec, and there must not have any residues/stains left on the classroom glass doors. 

 

Access to campus (WEF 12 Oct, ART update)

*	All attendees are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus (Please refer to email from OSL - Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 12 Oct 2021)

To put up wteboards Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Week 12

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 29 Nov. 
*	We will update you on the students access status after verification on the ART testing results for ts week. 

To remove wteboards Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Week 14

*	Please submit the attached declaration for the organizing mittee members and participants by 10 Dec. 
*	We will update you on the students access status by 13 Dec after verification on the ART testing results.

 

Photos

*	Please inform participants that photos and videos will be taken throughout the event for reporting and publicity purposes.
*	Please take photos of the event. (for online activity, screenshots are acceptable)

	*	Activity photos
	*	Group photos

 

Post Event Submission

*	After-Action Review

	*	Please submit the following to us by 22 Dec (Wed).

		*	Brief details of response and feedback
		*	Number of attendance
		*	Any interesting, pertinent points?
		*	6 photos 

Thank you. 

 



Suharti

Office of Student Life

 Requesting for an event approval for Week 11 

 

To Office of Student Life and Events,

 

Good afternoon, I am Cheng Wei Xuan from ROOT and I am writing ts email with  to requesting approval for my teamÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s event. 

 

Our event (A Collage Network) aims to motivate students by allowing students to send motivational messages and images to each other. The event will be split into 2 parts, an online and a physical. For the online ponent, we will be allowing the entire school to send their encouragement here padlet/ROOT_Welfare3/t1f3ozzfypy278z2 <apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook/?url=%3A%2F%2Fpadlet%2FROOT_Welfare3%2Ft1f3ozzfypy278z2Students&data=04%7C01%7C_%40.sutd..%7C2a8f126a64d447651df308d9b152d7c0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637735791806795427%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=jFHNP%2FqLbTF8thOqCb13k3Lia8PtuoVubxIwtnR1p5E%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Students can see each other messages through the same link. We intend to have the online munity board up from 15th November to 26th of November (Week 10 and 11).  At the end of the event on the 26th of November, my team intends to make a video collage of all the messages written and to display the video collage on the TV in the school canteen. We will only be able to send you the video on the 28th of November. Therefore, I would also like to check if there is an estimate on how long it would take before the video can be displayed on the tv as I undersd that the video needs to be approved first. We would like to display the collage video until the 17th of December (Week 14) when finals are over.

 

For the physical ponent, it will be targeted to the Term 1  students. We would like to paste wteboard sheets onto each Term 1 Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s classroom doors such that t can decorate and write motivational messages for each other for class bonding and to motivate the cohort. I have attached a layout of where we will be pasting the wteboard sheets in ts email. We would like to leave the wteboards from Week 11 till Week 14 until finals are over.

 

I've attached the Event Proposal Form as well as the Risk Assessment in ts email. If you have any further question you can always contact me. Thank you. 

 

Yours sincerely, 

Cheng Wei Xuan
