 EPF: SPROOT (Sprouting ROOT) 

 

 Events and OSL,

 

I'm sure you've been experiencing an increase in EPF and RAF since Week 9, mainly from ROOT. We deeply apologize for that and thank you so much for helping us make our ideas e true (like fairy god mothers). Once again sorry because there's another event (more of fifth row session) ing up! 

 



 

To celebrate the end of the events planned by the ining ROOT batch, we will be hosting a SPROOT session to wele their arrival to the ROOT family. It will be a 1.5h event, with 30min online and 1h physical. Do refer to the EPF, RAF and the floor plan attached for more information.

 

With  to SMM, we will adhere to the following:

*	Participants will have to keep a safe disce of at least 1-metre from others.
*	If there is more than one group sharing a space, the groups must maintain at least a disce of 3-metres apart from one another at all times.
*	Students will only be allowed to participate in fifth row activities on the days when t are schled for classes on campus.
*	Students are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus.
*	Masks must be kept on at all times.

I undersd that lessons for Term 6 students may still be online. We will ensure that t have classes that day or is a hostel resident and that their ART is negative before allowing them to attend the physical session. If not, t will attend the virtual session only.

 

As ts is considered a fifth-row session from ROOT, we will not be collecting any data. Thus, no sign-up form and PDPA form required.

 

As for the venues, we are looking for 5 tnk ks for the 5 different mittee. We are looking at maximum 20 people in a room (including secretary, existing ROOT directors and ining ROOT directors). Numbers vary from different room due to the difference in size of mittee. We will confirm the attendance closer to the date.

Start time/date 

End time/date 

Activity 

Venue 

No of Pax 

Logistics 

29 Nov 1900 hrs 

29 Nov 2200 hrs 

ROOT Fifth Row Session

Tnk k 13, 14, 15 

 

Capstone 3,4  

20 in each venue

Nil 

If any of the venue is unavailable, our second choices are Tnk k 11 & 12. If still unavailable, do suggest some nearby venues. Thanks a lot!

 

We apologize for the short timeline. Feel free to contact me via phone 97705194 or telegram @_ to seek any urgent clarifications needed. 

 

Hope to hear from you soon.

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare

We are looking for a simple wte cotton round neck, short sleeve srt with a simple (8cm * 8cm) logo printing in black ink on the sleeve or the front. As we are currently unsure on the potential numbers, we would like to seek 2 separate quotations, 1 for Qty: 300, 1 for Qty: 400.

Do you mean ts event is by invite only and not open for sign up so there will be no registration form or collecting of PDPA? Yup, ts event is only open to ROOT club members (i.e. the cabinet, secretary, directors). As it is not open to school like an organised event, we will not be having a sign up form. We will just be taking attendance on the day. 

 

WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re super grateful for your help. Hope to get the approval for ts session.

 

Yours sincerely,

 EPF: SPROOT (Sprouting ROOT) 

 

 Events and OSL,

 

I'm sure you've been experiencing an increase in EPF and RAF since Week 9, mainly from ROOT. We deeply apologize for that and thank you so much for helping us make our ideas e true (like fairy god mothers). Once again sorry because there's another event (more of fifth row session) ing up! 

 



 

To celebrate the end of the events planned by the ining ROOT batch, we will be hosting a SPROOT session to wele their arrival to the ROOT family. It will be a 1.5h event, with 30min online and 1h physical. Do refer to the EPF, RAF and the floor plan attached for more information.

 

With  to SMM, we will adhere to the following:

*	Participants will have to keep a safe disce of at least 1-metre from others.
*	If there is more than one group sharing a space, the groups must maintain at least a disce of 3-metres apart from one another at all times.
*	Students will only be allowed to participate in fifth row activities on the days when t are schled for classes on campus.
*	Students are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus.
*	Masks must be kept on at all times.

I undersd that lessons for Term 6 students may still be online. We will ensure that t have classes that day or is a hostel resident and that their ART is negative before allowing them to attend the physical session. If not, t will attend the virtual session only.

 

As ts is considered a fifth-row session from ROOT, we will not be collecting any data. Thus, no sign-up form and PDPA form required.

 

As for the venues, we are looking for 5 tnk ks for the 5 different mittee. We are looking at maximum 20 people in a room (including secretary, existing ROOT directors and ining ROOT directors). Numbers vary from different room due to the difference in size of mittee. We will confirm the attendance closer to the date.

Start time/date 

End time/date 

Activity 

Venue 

No of Pax 

Logistics 

29 Nov 1900 hrs 

29 Nov 2200 hrs 

ROOT Fifth Row Session

Tnk k 13, 14, 15 

 

Capstone 3,4  

20 in each venue

Nil 

If any of the venue is unavailable, our second choices are Tnk k 11 & 12. If still unavailable, do suggest some nearby venues. Thanks a lot!

 

We apologize for the short timeline. Feel free to contact me via phone 97705194 or telegram @_ to seek any urgent clarifications needed. 

 

Hope to hear from you soon.

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../> 

Director of Events & Welfare 

9th Student Government

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

Thanks for the approval! Devans has contacted you regarding the financial claims and invoice. So sorry for the troubles and confusion and thank you so much for being so patient too.

 

With  to the charity aspect, Cldren Wisng Well is open for the project. T are the only charity organisation in Singapore focused on the holistic cation of cldren and youth from disadvantaged backgrounds. So, our beneficiary are cldren from low-ine families, and their parents may be ill, incarcerated, or absent from their lives. Following are the campaign details with the poster. 

 

Campaign Title: SUTD Class of 2024 

Fundraising Goal: $800

About Campaign: As the batch approaches the end of  year, a significant milestone for us, we wish to do sometng meaningful together by giving back to the society. With Christmas approacng, we wish to raise fund for Cldren's Wisng Well, a non-profit organisation who provides support for cldren and youth from low-ine families. Ts includes cation, daily living needs and equipment them with skills for the future.

Start and End date of campaign: 6 Dec 2021 - 25 Dec 2021

Campaign URL: giving./SUTDClassOf2024

 



 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../>

 EPF: SPROOT (Sprouting ROOT) 

 

 Events and OSL,

 

I'm sure you've been experiencing an increase in EPF and RAF since Week 9, mainly from ROOT. We deeply apologize for that and thank you so much for helping us make our ideas e true (like fairy god mothers). Once again sorry because there's another event (more of fifth row session) ing up! 

 



 

To celebrate the end of the events planned by the ining ROOT batch, we will be hosting a SPROOT session to wele their arrival to the ROOT family. It will be a 1.5h event, with 30min online and 1h physical. Do refer to the EPF, RAF and the floor plan attached for more information.

 

With  to SMM, we will adhere to the following:

*	Participants will have to keep a safe disce of at least 1-metre from others.
*	If there is more than one group sharing a space, the groups must maintain at least a disce of 3-metres apart from one another at all times.
*	Students will only be allowed to participate in fifth row activities on the days when t are schled for classes on campus.
*	Students are subjected to the weekly ART testing and only students will valid negative ART results will be allowed to be back on campus.
*	Masks must be kept on at all times.

I undersd that lessons for Term 6 students may still be online. We will ensure that t have classes that day or is a hostel resident and that their ART is negative before allowing them to attend the physical session. If not, t will attend the virtual session only.

 

As ts is considered a fifth-row session from ROOT, we will not be collecting any data. Thus, no sign-up form and PDPA form required.

 

As for the venues, we are looking for 5 tnk ks for the 5 different mittee. We are looking at maximum 20 people in a room (including secretary, existing ROOT directors and ining ROOT directors). Numbers vary from different room due to the difference in size of mittee. We will confirm the attendance closer to the date.

End time/date

Tnk k 13, 14, 15 

 

Capstone 3,4

If any of the venue is unavailable, our second choices are Tnk k 11 & 12. If still unavailable, do suggest some nearby venues. Thanks a lot!

 

We apologize for the short timeline. Feel free to contact me via phone 97705194 or telegram @_ to seek any urgent clarifications needed. 

 

Hope to hear from you soon.

 

Yours sincerely,

 EPF: Freshnomore Event

 

 Events and OSL,

 

To celebrate the end of  term, we would be having a decorating srt event for the Term 3 SUTDents in Week 13-14 (because we can't have BBQ sadly). Ts idea is inspired by the signing on uniforms on the last day of secondary school. However, as we do not have uniforms, we will be giving wte srts out at $2 each. As the cost for 400 t-srts is more than $1k, my team have sent out quotation requests to different panies and would include it when requesting the purchase.

 



 

If we can get approval by next week and proceed with the sign-up form and purchase in time, here would be the ine collection details.

 

Details of ine collection: 

Start date of collection: 26 November 2021

End date of collection: 29 November 2021

Submit Wallet User(s) details 

Full Name (as per NRIC): Devans Jos 

Email (SUTD): 1005162 <mail1005162>  

Mobile Number: 93821256

 

We will adhere to the current SMM:

*	There should be at least 1-metre disce between individuals, or if ts is not possible, at least 2m discing between groups of no more than 5 persons for mask-on general activities. 

*	Attendance of each activity will be submitted to staff advisor witn the next day.  

*	No food and drink are to be supplied or consumed witn the activity area to ensure masks remain on (apart from bottled water). 

 

After confirming the collection date for the srts, I would send the names of the people helping at ROOT Cove to collect the srts and distribute to the class reps.

 

Hope to get your approval. Feel free to contact me at 97705194 for any clarification. 

 

Yours sincerely,

 

 

 <root.sutd../>

Here's the writeup on the event. Note that it ends at 6.30pm.

Subject: meeting/event
Body:
Attached is the Audition Schedule for the Science Buskers Festival.

Please look through and if you are not able to attend the allocated schedule for your audition, please let us know and we will try to accommodate to your preferred schedule as much as possible.

PM Session: 2.30pm to 4.30pm

Venue: Science Centre, Einstein Room @ Level 2

Subject: meeting/event
Body: There is nothing you are required to bring. Just you and your instrument. Timing for auditions are on 14/10/2016 7pm till 9pm.

Subject: meeting/event

our flagship SUTD Career and Internship Fair will be held virtually on 23rd March 2022. This annual event is your chance to network with potential employers, seek Full-time employment or find out more about Fall Internship opportunities.
